It's been a bumpy ride, but having faculty and stuff always kind and respectful to its students has made it worth my time here. The professors work hard to provide a great education and challenge each student's individuality while teaching students how to work cohesively in groups. 

Even if you don't come to attend, come along and check out the scenery especially during the fall and spring! I highly recommend it for events and photo shoots!

review.author: Tom B.
review.description: Everyone at Hollins can sleep sound tonight. Barney Fife chased out 3 high school girls who went there to take homecoming pictures because of the beauty of the campus. The girls were dangerous for sure?!  So anyway, the campus is safe tonight.... Oh and the admissions department just lost three potential applicants who are local and have over 4.0 gpas.

review.author: Sarah J.
review.description:
Beautiful private women's university. Walked around the campus during Thanksgiving break and some of the places were open although there were very few staff and students hanging around for the holiday. Large, spread out, but with a small town feel, sort of like the cities surrounding. The entrance is pretty and the campus is hidden behind it over the hills. 

We did get to go in the library, which is fairly outfitted but not as large as some university collections. It was a gorgeous space overall! Definitely had that old world scholarly feel.

Rating system:
5 stars = I'll drive across town specifically for this, and rave to all my friends about it!
4 stars = Would recommend visiting.
3 stars = Average, acceptable, positive.
2 stars = You might be able to drag me here.
1 star = I will not be returning.

review.author: Jana S.
review.description: I went to Greenbrier about 7 years ago. I have mixed feelings on this place. The staff and the girls were all amazing, friendly and caring. However the actual treatment aspects were not  great what so ever. They barely teach you how to handle your emotions and feelings. The staff recommended a wilderness program because I was not doing well in their program. I was not able to do well because they didn't teach me anything and were less than helpful. The school is barely a school but the teachers are kind. Now I can't say how well the program is doing  now since it has been such a long time. But I hope they have put some changes into the Managment as well as their therapeutic aspects.

review.author: J B.
review.description:
I am a very private person that shuns social media and normally would not post anything on Yelp or any other site.  However, my wife and I read reviews regarding "therapeutic" boarding schools during a very stressful and troubling time when we had no answers at home (whatsoever) and seemingly no options with my increasingly troubled teen daughter.  The Yelp reviews (both positive and negative) about Greenbrier Academy were really meaningful in compelling us (as a family) to visit and consider the program as an option and so - after my daughter graduated from a year-long program a few months ago, I am writing this review during a Parents weekend at her new college-prep school where she is absolutely glowing and thriving.  My daughter's hard work and desire for a better life coupled with the Greenbrier Academy program and excellent staff (everyone at the school) made this all possible.  Worth every penny.

As you read these reviews, please understand that the GBA therapy curriculum focuses on the entire family dynamic (and not just the troubled teen girls).  This seems to be an unwelcome surprise to some parents who are simply unwilling to admit the part their behavior plays in an unhealthy home environment that is often the root cause of teen trouble.  If you are a parent and you do not love your kid enough to drop your ego and work just as hard via therapy to change your own destructive behavior then do everyone a favor and admit this up front.  Greenbrier can handle the rest if you do the work and admit that it's time to listen to experienced professionals construct a customized treatment plan to help your daughter figure things out for herself and set her on the path for self-reliance.

There are no shortcuts unfortunately.  You have to do the work.  But the Greenbrier program and Mike Beswick's excellent and experienced staff make all the difference.  You can sleep well at night knowing that your daughter is safe and that the most important things in her life at this moment are being addressed in the most fair and impactful way possible.  The results speak for themselves.  Worth every penny.

review.author: Patty M.
review.description: I can't say enough good things about Greenbrier Academy and how they helped my family.  Our daughter had struggled for years with ODD and anxiety.  Our family walked on eggshells daily and we couldn't even enjoy a meal together without a huge blowup.  We enrolled our daughter as a last ditch effort to help her, but the staff at Greenbrier made us realize that our whole family needed help!  Mike and Greta, you saved my family and I will be forever grateful.

review.author: Dorit F.
review.description: Our daughter's experience at the Greenbrier Academy has been truly life altering. Our 16-year old daughter suffered from anxiety and depression, self harm and suicide attempts that lasted 4 years and worsened over time, despite many interventions and therapeutic assistance. When we decided to enroll her in the Survival Skills Wilderness program at Trails Carolina, it was because we reached the end of the road. We were afraid she would not reach her 17th birthday. Our daughter graduated wilderness with a renewed sense of self esteem and a positive perspective on life and life's worth. Going from wilderness to the real world would have been challenging still so we decided to enroll her in the short-term program at the Greenbrier Academy for Girls in West Virginia. It was the best decision for us and for our daughter. The Greenbrier Academy offers excellent therapeutic and academic programs with experienced teachers and seasoned therapists, people who deeply care about the girls and their academic and therapeutic success. The program is headed by 2 amazing directors: Head of Guidance, Michael Beswick and Academic Director, Lowell Galford. I cannot begin to express our appreciation and gratitude to these 2 individuals and their teams. Their level of care, their expertise, their experience and the efforts they undertook on behalf of our daughter were tremendous. They succeeded not only in encouraging our daughter to turn her life around and change her misguided perceptions and beliefs, but they also assisted the whole family to heal and reconnenct. Mr. Galford's guidance throughout was invaluable, especially towards graduation. Mike Beswick's ability to get deep into the core issues at the 3-day Parent Program is extraordinary. Having experienced the Parent Program he leads one can easily see why he is a master at what he does. You could literally see how these young women are finally able to understand how their skewed perceptions of themselves are at the core of their struggle. And you could also see how parents are finally able to look deep into themselves and their actions and understand how it affected their children. From day 1 to day 3 the turnaround happening in front of your eyes is magical (of course it takes many months of hard work beforehand). GBA also offers the 'Village' experience where the girls spend time away from the main building looking deep into themselves and their value as human beings. Paul Fowler, the director who runs the Village experience is a most amazing master therapist. My daughter said the most impactful experience she's had at GBA was Village, guided by Paul. She had experienced it 3 times and it was the primary experience that helped her finally realize who she is and believe there is a purpose to her life. GBA parents are also supported and guided by a highly experienced Family Therapist, Greta Lutman, who is very capable at bringing opposing forces - parents who perceive things differently - to work together in an effort to assist their child. With the assistance of all these wonderful people our daughter was able to reconnect with herself and change her misguided perceptions. And we, as parents, were able to better understand each other and our child. It was a remarkable experience that turned our lives around. Our daughter has been home for less than 10 days now and she is submitting her college applications. She is highly motivated and is looking forward to her future - which is so heartwarming. Of course not every girl is able to turn her life around in a short 4-month program. I also cannot pretend that everything at GBA was perfect. I feel the school could benefit from being better organized, especially if a point person could be assigned so parents can bring in non-therapeutic issues and concerns. We had to be persistent and highly involved all along, especially towards graduation. But GBA's ability to tailor specific therapeutic and academic programs to each and every girl is really the basis for its success and maybe a certain level of disorganization is the outcome of that... It's a small price to pay in light of the tremendous success that can be achieved. We are grateful to everyone at the GBA for bringing us our daughter back to us, strong, positive and motivated!

review.author: Sharon C.
review.description: As other reviews have stated, Greenbrier Academy literally saved our daughter's life. A top student and athlete, her life suddenly began to unravel in 9th grade. Psychiatrists, therapists, even hospitalization did nothing to help her. After spending 10 weeks in an outstanding wilderness program (SUWS of the Carolinas), she spent a year at Greenbrier. There aren't enough words to describe the outstanding staff. John Grago, Mike Beswick, Lowell Galford, Kelly Beasley, Rachel Call, LJ, Paul and Greta, Sarah and Angel each played a role in our daughter's transformation, and our family will be forever grateful. The African drumming program, Village, overseas service trip, parent programs and aftercare coaching program are all part of the magic of this very unique and special school. Our daughter is now thriving as a junior in high school and has discovered the lasting treasures of joy, purpose and gratitude. Her experience was so meaningful, she is now looking ahead at becoming a wilderness therapist. I cannot recommend this school highly enough for any family in need of help and healing. Thank you Greenbrier!

review.author: Hil D.
review.description: You child would be better off in a prison.  The show they put on for our tour is NOTHING like the horrific life my daughter suffered there.  As a parent I made a mistake of taking advice from an education consultent and a 8 week program helping my daughter deal with anxiety and depression .  She was NOT at risk for alcohol  or drug abuse . She did not lie or steal and she did not harm herself or anyone else.  I have heard from others that these "Wilderness " programs have ties to theraputic schools.  I am starting to believe this more than ever because her so called "caring " therapist recomended this knowing she was not at high risk.  According to my daughters current therapist she is suffering PTSD because of the trauma she was exposed to at Greenbrier .  PLEASE DO NOT LISTEN TO EDUCATIONAL CONSULTENT or "WILDERNESS PROGRAM " unless you want your daughter to suffer .  I suggest you try everything to find a good theraputic school if you must after trying everything else.  I can tell you Greenbrier is NOT a good one at all. I had a gut instinct to get my daughter out of there before the year .    The food was horrible , verbal and physical assaults by other students  was a reoccuring theme , there is no real education ( be prepared for your daughter to lose a year of proper education ) , theft is as normal as going to the bathroom there ! i forgot to mention for $90,000 a year my daughters therapist was NOT licensed .  This place is a scam and so was the program that ecommended it.  They take advantage of parents that would do anything for their children.  It makes me sick that this DISGUSTING place still operates!!!

review.author: Larry L.
review.description: Trillium is a cornerstone of the vibrant arts life in my town, and our family now has its third generation learning and performing with them. Trillium classes are taught by positive, caring and talented artists, both on their stage at the Lewis Theatre and nearby studios,for people age 3-senior adult.  I have taken classes, performed and attended dozens of shows Performances are creative, stimulating and varied, whether a full professional concert or the casual Friday Night Alive! showcases.

name: Stanberry Public Schools Special Ed Dept

review.author: Sara S.
review.description: Amazing staff and facility! We love sending our daughter here. She gets so much attention and is engaged in activities all day long. The facility is so clean and organized. It puts me at ease knowing our daughter is here with people who genuinely care about her development and her well being. They use Brightwheel and keep parents updated all day long! It is so easy to get in touch with them for any question or any kind of check in I have during the day. It really puts me at ease knowing I can be so in touch while away from our daughter !

review.author: Michelle C.
review.description: I am the 5th director of this center in a year. I was fired for having a disability. The owner told me not to return to work after being out for medical reasons over a 2 week period. I had 2 doctors notes for leave. She also told me to get another profession because of my disability. I only give 2 stars because some of the staff are amazing. They deserve better. The owner allows extreme behavioral problems in the classroom and does not allow teachers to tell parents. She is very ignorant of how or what to do with classroom management,  curriculum development,  staff training, budgeting etc... This is a BABYSITTING AND CRAFTS ONLY CENTER. Just spend time observing or asking questions. The owner is also very ignorant of DHS licensing guidelines. Just know you get a glazed and happy version of what is really happening from the owner. Good luck finding childcare. Just not here. Look on Better Beginnings.com to find 3 star childcare!

review.author: Max A.
review.description: Great Sewing resource in the Fort Smith area, friendly and knowledgeable staff at a very convenient location.

review.author: Craig G.
review.description: Best Defensive Driving School in the River Valley. The great thing about this school is that it is not owned by a cop! Awesome instructor and not boring at all. I learned a lot and had a great time.

review.author: Ron N.
review.description:
Pretty good cafeteria food. I loved the fried chicken strips with a cup of cheese. 

Oh my gosh their cheese. Its like runny, but sweet, but cheesy!

Over-all actually a pretty good education. Despite the ghettofabulousness.

review.author: Payal K.
review.description:
We moved to Fort Smith for a new project and my son was suddenly exposed to a completely new environment, food , language and culture. 
The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. His teacher Ms Teresa helped my son settle down in no time. He loved school and all his friends. 
The director of the school Sherry is extremely approachable and a very loving n caring person herself. 
We have now since moved to another location and another state but my son still misses his friends and teacher at Cavanaugh.
Good Luck u guys You are doing a great job We miss you

review.author: Laura D.
review.description: Great positive atmosphere! Inspirational music and conservative ideals have kept us here for more than 8 years. Dancing is fun!

review.author: Charley N.
review.description: This is my daughters 4th year dancing at Shining Stars Dance School. We love it! Great, positive atmosphere. Christian enviroment. My daughter can't wait for dance class every week. All the teachers are awesome.

review.author: Ramona H.
review.description: Save your money for a real college. Also, get everything in writing and keep it, even after graduation. The college is not what it used to be, even a year ago. It has greatly changed with the new chancellor. You get what you pay for.

review.author: Tami M.
review.description: The post by Diane L was recently brought to my attention.  It is exceptionally misleading and emotionally charged.  Tara Mishra has consistently provided his students with superior instruction.  More than likely, this is a disgruntled student or acquaintance.   Apparently this was written in Norway, which really raises suspicion.  In conclusion most negative reviews are unreliable.

review.author: Diane L.
review.description:
Great But if You are in IT WATCH OUT for Dr. Tara Mishra

I found my overall experience here to be (above my expectations) and the majority of the faculty to be extremely down-to-earth and helpful. However, there was one faculty member in particular (Dr. Tara Mishra in IT) who freaked many of us out and I have been wanting to complain about him for years, but kept my mouth shut, because he has this way of gagging people via subtle intimidation tactics. If he felt like you were under his spell, he would make disparaging remarks about woman, certain races and faculty members who seemed to be on his perpetual shit list. He would then add humor to his statements so it wouldn't seem too horrible. Regardless it was unprofessional and many of us lost respect for him. He was constantly making bizarre comments about how his computer is acting like so and so in the department, his ex - wife or how the system was as inefficient as the chancellor. Sometimes students heard him howling at people on the phone before he realized someone was outside his door. At times he would try to drag others into some drama he was instigating with other faculty or students. That was way out of line!! 
If you did not concur with him he would act like an over-inflated peacock and brag about his stellar academic history and position. This would be followed up by tales of his big shot professor brother from Australia who had powerful 'connections' so he doesn't have to worry. I perceived this as if you don't play my game, I'm going to seriously mess you up. 
Well I will be leaving the country PERMANENTLY, off the grid for awhile so I am taking the opportunity to get this off my chest! If his big shot brother is that desperate to track me down for speaking my mind, he has more issues than 'Dr. Mishra'. Dr. Tara Mishra, Its pathetic I have to use an alias to make this review, because I know he probably would track me down.
Future students watch out for this guy! He will try to get to know you by finding out the troubles in your life and offering you saint-like assistance. If you make the mistake of telling him your problems or accepting help from him (I mean other than typical academic advising). He will carefully file all this information away and be especially nice to you. Gradually he will try to reel into some political game he is playing on campus. I have heard of him going as far as coercing people to outright lie for him (even in court). I believe he only does this to select people with whom he's been able to play on their vulnerabilities. I think that because many people who do deal with him have never heard or seen anything to give them a negative impression. If you want to have an academic relationship with him, your fine. He's pretty smart, but NEVER tell him about your sick grandma, your impoverished parents or ANY personal problems. If you do you will be the proverbial frog in water that gradually reaches boiling and become his puppet.

review.author: Daniel S.
review.description:
This is a very money-hungry administration and they do not treat people appropriately. During the corona virus pandemic they wanted to continue to charge all students full tuition ($1423 per month per child or $2846 total for our two kids). Our children are ages 2 and 4, and The New School essentially serves as an educational day care for our family. They would not offer a refund for the period of time that school was out so I got a lawyer involved. I have no problem paying for services as long as services are being received. They ultimately waived the payments in question, but I just found out today that they also cancelled our children's enrollment for the 2020-2021 year without our permission. We never asked to have the children removed from the school. The head of school (Nancy) will not even communicate with us directly anymore. When we reach out with questions about enrollment she simply says that only our lawyers can communicate going forward. 

We have several friends whose children are there currently, and they are having similar issues. One couple in particular wanted to withdrawal from the school electively due to safety concerns surrounding the pandemic. Even though school has not officially started for the academic year, they were told that if they pulls out their children that they will still owe full contract price for the academic year (roughly $15,250 per child) because it is after July 1st. Hopefully, you are starting to get the picture. 

We enjoyed the school itself and the teachers. I had no problems with the education component of the program. However, the money-driven nature of the school poisons the environment. It is not worth the ultra-high premium that they require for tuition. Maybe the K-12 experience is difference, but the contracts they have for the early childhood education is absurd. They are more interested in taking your money than doing what is right. 

I have since gladly taken my children elsewhere.

review.author: Mikesia H.
review.description:
I highly highly HIGHLY recommend this facility for childcare. My 3 yo has never been with anyone from birth to now. But with work between my husband and I we had to get her in somewhere. Swiftly. But of course you can not trust just anyone with your babies. 

Our little one is very cautious when meeting new people. She's reserved. And not open at all to being around strangers. She's never been around a group of little ones or teachers alone. So this was super new for her and us. Of course for the first day-week she cried when we left her there. But as the first week was coming to a close we noticed a major difference. 

She started talking about her "friends" and she wanted to "go see the kids". Oh and her teacher...Ms. Janay! She is THE BEST! And she loves Ms. Keisha! All of the staff are kind hearted. Respectful. Welcoming. Loving. The right people you would want taking care of your child when you are not around. Also, and this may not mean much for some...but this facility is the most diverse facility I visited when shopping for childcare. I believe this is important and was indeed the biggest factor in our little brown girl feeling safe and secure. There were people there that looked like her own family at home. I can't thank them enough.

review.author: Jeni K.
review.description: Cadence is the best place you can take your child! I attended three birthday parties this past weekend and all were other kids in my child's class. Every kid that attended from his class supported the birthday child. They cheered for them and knew that the cake and gifts were for that particular kid! They truly teach kindness of their friends. We would never send our child to any other school.

review.author: Keali G.
review.description: I rarely leave reviews but we we found Cadence Academy and it was amazing. The staff were very helpful and super friendly! Highly recommend!

review.author: Amy B.
review.description: I have four children and they have all attended Cadence Academy. My oldest 2 completed the Jr. K program and were very well prepared for kindergarten. My youngest 2 still attend. The teachers in the minnows room are gentle and loving. They work with the babies to do fun arts and crafts, teach them sign language, and cuddle and love them. My baby has never had a need that was not met. She is happy and excited when I drop her off at school. She's attended since 8 weeks and I've never once had a complaint.\n\nMy 2 year old also attends Cadence. His teachers have the patience of saints. Toddlers are not always easy, and though I've seen quite a few outbursts from the kids as toddlers will do, I've never once seen a teacher raise her voice or lose patience. They love the kids and teach them structure, love, and acceptance. Ms. Kayla and Ms. Jessica in particular have been wonderful with my son and have worked with him and with us tirelessly during the "joys" of potty training. I recommend this place 100% and love it so much that we drive a half an hour each way just so my kids can attend. If you want a loving environment with values and education, this is the place to be.

review.author: Donald C.
review.description: Would recommend this facility to anyone who needs a child care providers they go above and beyond to teach our children how are 16 month old granddaughter has learned baby sign language and compassion for other children and has overall learned to get along while playing with others

review.author: Daryl A.
review.description: For the best hair cut or stylists Hair Design is the place to go. Yes they are students but well instructed and supervised. I have been using them for over 15 years. You will be greeted be with a welcoming smile. They are  Students eager to develop their skill in a competitive profession. They listen to what you want. After consulting with certified instructors they focus their attention to you. As young adults learning; starting their chosen career in Hair Design. \nI use the same 'artist' till she graduates. No where can beat the price. Even adding a cash tip to the practicing stylist I leave refreshed. The school of Hair Design is top of the line for. They are the best.

review.author: Zoe D.
review.description: Place is full of uneducated stylists who don't know how to properly do hair besides a basic trim IF THAT. The place is crawling with racists and can't teach anything useful for you to purse a promising career. Do not go here.

review.author: Tabitha E.
review.description: If you are looking for a quality education in cosmology, do not waste your time here. Look elsewhere even if it seems too "branded". Career academy of hair design seems to spend its students tuition on insuring they don't learn much about modern, fashionable hair design. Instead it hires people who graduated from their school in 2019 to teach! You will not be taught by experienced professionals, you won't be taught much that will make you a serious competitor in your field, you'll have to do that yourself here. If you only want to learn the most basic and OUTDATED concepts of hair, with little guidance, this is the place for you. Not to mention a few of the staff members could really use a lesson on racial sensitivity. A lot of poor behaviour is let slide in this place, a lack of professionalism, and an uncomfortable environment for students of color. The price of tuition does not reflect the quality of education at all. I was overall disappointed.

review.author: Talara T.
review.description: Our family loves Art of Motion! Our daughter is 3, and is usually pretty shy and clingy when Mama is around. AOM takes the kids to the studio, sans parents, and we can watch them practice from the monitors in the waiting area. She enjoys class much better this way, as compared to our experience at another studio. Class is always on time, and her coach Cortney is really great. Costumes for recital are here well ahead of time, and of great quality. Overall, we have had an exceptional experience here, and highly recommend AOM!

review.author: Kevin V.
review.description: My daughter just started at The Art of Motion this year, and she is really improving! The quality of instruction there just can't be beat. The teachers have really helped my daughter's confidence, too. You can tell that they love teaching and take their job as a role model very seriously. We're so glad we made the switch!

review.author: Lyla W.
review.description: Greek life is great. Colleges are great. Horrible living, absolutely no parking. parking is given to freshman that already live on campus...

review.author: Matthew P.
review.description:
This is solely in regards to their online schematics. They clearly do not know how to create a student-friendly internet experience as well as with advising. It is a system to set students up for failure with appointments for advising being far apart and scarce. No matter how early you get on advising for example, there will be a line (which is fine, we are all struggling to get in), and then it will kick you out of line if you aren't glued to the screen for who knows how long. 

The campus is beautiful, the professors are generally friendly, but the online navigation for students is just TERRIBLE. It's as if both students and faculty are trying to figure out how to connect online. 

I just want to make it possible to do it myself, but I've got to navigate through a sea to meet the people before I can edit a schedule or change minds about majors.

review.author: Luiz L.
review.description: Terrific school, one thing that I have always wondered though is that if the university is that of diversity than why have I never seen anything that promotes males or every race as a whole? As I walk through the halls of any building I notice that the only things ever promoted consistently are organizations focusing on LGBTQ and women, a long with a few minorities here and there. Aside of that note, has anyone ever noticed how LGBTQ has there own parades and is clearly nurtured, but when it comes to Veterans Day or something that includes making the ultimate sacrifice there is little to nothing.

review.author: Avery C.
review.description:
Going to this school was a miserable decision, professors, advisors, & employees treat you like another number out of thousands, there is no individuality, and the lack of communication that comes from everyone involved with this university has caused an unruly amount of stress for both me and my parents. 

It is over-priced, a party school, and everyone at this school has been overall unhelpful. 
Transferring was a GREAT choice.

review.author: Bruce K.
review.description:
Woo! Pig! Soooie!

As the bumper sticker says, my daughter and my money go to the University of Arkansas. Mom and I got a brief guided tour from her this weekend, walking through the campus, the bookstore (I bought a Razorbacks t-shirt and a hat), the student union and the building where she attends class.

U of A is a major school, founded in 1871. As you would expect for the school where the arena is named after the brother of one of Wal-Mart's founders, there is also the Sam M. Walton College of Business. Tyson is a major employer in the area, so they also have a large college for agricultural science, specifically related to poultry (chicken) sciences. The Razorbacks have reasonably decent football and basketball teams that play in the Southeast Conference.

review.author: Cierra B.
review.description: I went to game day to watch the red and white game and one of the security guard was so rude. We were sitting down with everyone around us. And the security guard said we had to get up and move, so we get up and move but a little kid is standing up and other people are in the same spot that we're just in, but they never had to move. I'm very disappointed in the way that the University Of Arkansas security had become. It makes me never want to come back.

review.author: Ed S.
review.description: Well I'm a tenured professor here so I may be a bit biased but U of A is a great school for its size.  The state of Arkansas will never have the resources that Texas or California have to lavish on their institutions of higher education.  Keeping this in mind I believe it's accurate to consider Arkansas an excellent university and a great value.

review.author: Daisy D.
review.description: Wooooooo Pig Sooie! Razorbacks! We were in town for graduation weekend and had some time to walk around campus and check out the place my nephew called home for the last four years. It's a relatively small and easily walkable campus. While you can get to some of the outskirts of campus, you can't drive through the center which makes it very pedestrian friendly. \n\nNo shyness from the local 'empires' with both Tyson and Walton being big players on campus. Still being a relatively 'small' school in the SEC it has some 'perks' that other bigger schools don't necessarily see. Would have never really had a reason to see NW Arkansas or Fayetteville, but glad I can add it to my 'been there, done that' list.

review.author: Alexander S.
review.description: Do not recommend riding a bike in the rain from the science and engineering building to hotz hall

review.author: Cole F.
review.description: Be careful ever taking any of their distance learning courses.  I applied and never received any confirmation of acceptance or enrollment.  They said they sent me an email.  A single email, nothing in the mail, not a second email wondering why I had not participated in a single lesson, nothing.  Then these crooks send me a bill after the course time had expired and threaten collections for a class I never knew I was enrolled in.  I thought, well they are reasonable people, once I explain and they notice I didn't take part it will be obvious that I didn't know I was enrolled.  NOPE!  (what school doesn't take at least a portion of tuition up front anyway?)  There is no way I could have known that they enrolled me.  It is like Jed Clamped is running the distance learning department.  They basically extorted me for $350.  Look elsewhere.

review.author: Marklin M.
review.description: Suey! Is all that comes to mind when I think of this place. Man I stayed in Rogers AR for about 5 months back in the day and got to spend a considerable amount of time on the campus with the players on the basketball team who were just good 'ol stand up southern boys. Everyone on campus was so friendly and the campus is very spacious and clean, I couldn't help but fall in love with it. Lucky for me Football season came along before I left and some locals took me to a Razoback's game against Univ of Miami! Great game and I never heard so many people chant SUEY in my whole life and those who know me know that I am an avid pig collector so I was right at home. If you are in Razorback country and especially if you are a sports junky like me, this must go in your to-do list!!  Oink Oink!!!

review.author: Veronika S.
review.description:
I attended this University during 2004-2005 so probably a lot has changed but my experience was pretty good. There were students from all over the country and all over the world. There was a class where I knew two people from high school and another friend named Paul. Most classes were lectures, which I like because I sit there and take notes and there's so many people that it's hard to start drama. My government class was in a theater and the person that sat next to me was the security at the art gallery and he was so nice. Some classes were small but they were fine too and I met someone from Detroit and we did group activities in that class and they went well, no disasters.

An advisor told me that even though the zoology department was gone I could still go to school and then my degree would show that I graduated with a degree in zoology. The last time I saw an advisor she told me that it was untrue. I failed biology twice (I know zoology major fails biology, but trust me I'm better at animal sciences) and then gave up which is sad because I wasted so much opportunity and the scholarship I received and fell behind to the point that I've been in an out of school, well when I moved to a new state the University said they couldn't find my transcript and I did read about the University losing school records, maybe now that digital has been around for a while they can find my transcript. I don't get the Razorback thing but I've moved around my whole life so I don't get school spirit in general. I felt that this school (I could be wrong) was moving towards becoming a sports school or training place for future athletes, which is ok.

After the head of NORML came to speak the NORML Representative at the University was expelled and a lot of people thought it was because the University wanted to lessen NORML's power or get rid of the organization.

This was the last place where I had solid friends but some people can become violent quick without any provocation, the cops used to stop my boyfriend and I every time we would walk to the store- never got violent thank God but it happened so often that one time a cop waved at my boyfriend, my boyfriend couldn't get a job as a bagger at a grocery store because he has long hair, there's also the whole clinics are bad and make women promiscuous. There are some people in the area that still have old-fashioned beliefs and it's not just the older generation but the older generation passes it on to the younger generation. If someone is not used to this then it can be a real shock, it was for me. I was forced to move to the area by my dad so the negatives were probably ten times worse. If I had a choice I would have gone back to my birthplace to finish high school and lived with my Grandma, not that there's anything wrong when I went to Fayetteville High School but that's another review.

Sorry this is so long I do that on Yelp reviews, I wanted to write this review because I wanted to write about a good school experience because on my other school Yelp reviews I come off as some kind of nutjob.

name: Presybterian Medical Servcs Hd Strt & Erly Hd Strt

review.author: Drinny F.
review.description: My child began late last year and the beginning this year my child was assigned the same teacher and classroom. School was great until my child said he was afraid to go to school. My child said his teacher hurt him. An investigation was done. There are cameras in the classroom, the playground and parking lot.  The investigation was concluded and the teacher has returned. Unfortunately, we have have lost faith in the school.

name: A Gold Star Academy & Child Development Center

review.author: Rosa V.
review.description: after complaining about my child being neglected and put in danger they told us we needed to leave stating I made them nervous (I wonder why)they left my child in throw up laying on her back and when I came in to check on her they lectured me she was choking and left in a full diaper and I took a picture of it and was told my child and I had to leave after I reported the woman sitting there doing nothing but coloring my child had a bad reaction to formula when my child is strictly breast feed they threw out all my babies breast milk out and when we were told to leave they threw all my child's things in a garbage bag I was told by the teacher that another mother was complaining to them about them over feeding her baby and I watched them give that baby formula when that poor baby was only breast fed like my baby This is the worst place ever it really should be investigated when I came in to get my refund they kept it all and only gave me partial please do not take your kids here please believe me this is such a terrible place they hide a lot of stuff from parents about there kids u know this place is bad  when the secretary up front uses chew and spits in a can How do u neglect. 2 month old baby and when they are called on it they throw u out it's all about the money here

review.author: Vicki W.
review.description:
We hosted a large motorcoach rally recently in Farmington, NM and had occasion to meet Dr. Teun Fetz and his Symphonic Band.
What a treat!! Ages range from 14 years of age to 80 years of age in this Community band. You can tell the love and willingness to work for Dr. Fetz with this group!
They played for over an hour and that was not long enough!!
It is so encouraging to find the Arts still being taught in our schools. 
Next time our group goes to Farmington, this group will be invited to come and play for us!

review.author: Camila A.
review.description: Worst place I ever worked or studied. Shaddy place and the HR team does not care about its people. Will throw you under the bus for any little thing. You will feel like you are about to be fired all the time.

review.author: Jorge R.
review.description: I love the instructors. Awesome people. Only one or two have been difficult with communication. Other than that they're awesome. However, I call it the hallway, where everything is done for registration and student debt. This "hallway" is full of difficulty and they make it hard to get things done. One person really helped me and she was able to walk me through every station. I realize everyone has their part in the process, but it gets tiring when everyone just passes you on to the next person over and over again. I feel bad because the lady that helped me I had a bad attitude towards at first, but she was literally the last person I spoke to after all the chaos. It's not an excuse to act that way and I feel bad for it. I just wish all the employees down that hallway were as proactive as she is. Hopefully things change next year and I can change my view on this school as a whole.

review.author: Caitlin A.
review.description:
I attended this college online for their veterinary technician program.  The program itself was great, and the professors were amazing.  I attended the Fast Track labs where you good with the professors for a weekend with 11 or so other students at a farm in Texas and learn/perform your large animal skills.  I was super stressed out about it since all my experience in the field was with small animals, but they (Mrs. Black, and Dr. Wright) were great teachers and were very patient with us.  They are what all teachers should be like.  Sherry Hair, the academic advisor, was always very helpful whenever we had phone appointments, and you really feel like she cares about your success, just like the teachers do.    

But....  The school itself was difficult to work with.  These courses are very competitive to get into (which is understand). When the courses open up, you have to be by a computer to get a seat (especially towards the end of the program).  There were multiple clerical errors on my account that on 2 separate occasions caused me to not be able to enroll in the classes I needed on time. The system literally would let me put my courses in my "cart", but would't let me enroll and told me to contact administration.  When I called them regarding the issue (the same day courses opened up), they told me that my mailing address was wrong (it wasn't, they've been mailed me things in the past).  When I told them it was correct, they opened up my ability to enroll in the courses, but it was too late and the classes were full.  I had to monitor the seats every day until someone got dropped for non-payment.  

Their financial aid department messed up my aid EVERY semester.  FAFSA actually denied me aid once because they filled out the form so sloppily (that is actually when they told me, and they sent me copy of what they were sent).  Whenever I'd called and no one answers, I'd leave a message and never get a call back.  One week I called them three times and left messages every time, and I never got a call back.  When I finally got a hold of someone, they transferred me to someone's mailbox, and I'd leave a message there only to be ignored there too.  Finally when I spoke with someone and told them that they messed up my paperwork, they told me to just come down next time to fill out the paperwork.  I live in Arizona.  The school is in New Mexico.  I shouldn't have to drive/fly 400 miles because they can't fill out a form correctly.  The last semester or two I didn't even bother applying for financial aid because of the hassle and put the tuition on credit cards because I'd rather pay the interest than deal with them.  My last semester I had to call multiple times to get a hold of someone regarding my transcripts.  

The quality of this school (at least the veterinary technician program) is great, but forget it if you live in a different state.  You will have a hard time getting anything done if you have to call the front office for anything.  Whenever people ask me if they should look into this school for their certification, I tell them no and that the program is great, but the school itself is hard to work with and it's like pulling teeth to get anything done.  I have to give it 2 stars because if I had to do it over again, I wouldn't just because of the front office issues.

review.author: Sarah C.
review.description: i love this school more than anything! I've attended west side for the past 13 years of my entire school years. i just graduated this May and I can't even begin to describe how amazing the teachers, staff, coaches and students are! all the teachers want is for you to succeed and they show that very well. i have always felt at home here and will miss it more than anything!

review.author: Ezekiel C.
review.description:
Ive been a part of the Gospel Light family for awhile now and there are three things that this church exudes. 1. It is active/alive. This church is not a place where you just sit enjoy one service a week, but a place where you will always have opportunities to serve, give, and be a part of a community 
2. It is totally focused on Jesus. Not a lot to explain other than that you can tell God is in charge and directs this church. 
3. It is loving. People are so welcoming, and you can tell that this type of culture is led by the pastor who will always make sure to tell you that he loves you haha!

Also, massive renovations have been done recently that have really amped up the place; very diverse church in ages and cultures which makes it great for just about anyone.

name: Quapaw Drug & Alcohol Saftey Education Program

review.author: Carla S.
review.description: ACA has been built on Education and Christian values.  September 1, 2022, a professional teacher that has had 13 years of classroom experience was let go without an explanation, or counseling. This teacher started ACA from scratch. After at least 2 years of dedication, goal oriented and a passion to give students a safe place to learn. During the process of letting this teacher go without any warning.  Education or students were never mentioned. It was all political! Lies were given to the parents and community.\nThe board of ACA is very unprofessional, disrespectful and unappreciative of anyone who does not help their agenda.\nA great school was torn apart because of politics.

review.author: Randy B.
review.description: If college your direction Allow a conversation with Class 101 to see if they assist with College Prep and scholarships.

review.author: Ed S.
review.description: Have sent several friends & family to Class 101. Every time, they raised the students scores to the point where the student received so much money in financial aide, that their service paid for itself 5x over! They really care about the students they work with - and the proof is in the results!

review.author: Sharon P.
review.description: I totally wish I had the services of "College 101" when my girls were getting ready for  university!  I could have afforded the RV that I want now! Good, easy to work with and so proactive in making sure that kids get scholarships. I've heard so many good things from people who got started when their children were juniors in high school.

review.author: Aaron S.
review.description: Randy and Kim provide a service that anyone planning to be in college needs to take advantage of. When I was paying for schooling I followed the advice of the counselors and paid for it! Randy and Kim will help you get ahead.... their numbers and experiences are really impressive. If you are stressed about college... these are the people you need to see.

review.author: Karin D.
review.description: I have referred several friends with students entering high school to Randy and Kim.  Everyone I have sent to them has always been impressed with the amount of help they provide them.  Not only do they prepare the teens for all the testing, but they also help them with their resumes, such that colleges not only just accept their applications, but want them to attend their college (providing scholarships and discounts).  In today's competitive market, it pays to have professional help to have all your options laid out for you.

review.author: Karen P.
review.description: Randy and Kim will help you increase test scores, prepare for essays, create resumes, navigate the insanity of school financing/scholarship options, and get offers from more colleges.  Every parent can use that kind of help, early in the game!

review.author: F B.
review.description: I took both the phlebotomy class and Med Tech class with this facility and I learned a lot. I am more comfortable with drawing blood then I was before. Classes are small and it is a lot of hands on training which is what I needed.

review.author: Jay C.
review.description: GRAND place to take your kids for preschool.  I would without a doubt say this is the best preschool in the Lakeside School District.  Mrs. Chris is the best!

review.author: Erica V.
review.description:
I do not know what I would do without Kaplan.

I initially took their LSAT Extreme class a few years ago when I was on my "I never lose and argument and I love pencil-skirts so let me go to law school" kick and I was not disappointed! My instructor, Erik Hamlin, is just short of maniacally good at what he does. His energy was through the roof and he really livened up the oft-boring LSAT prep. The center is clean, modern and you feel like they really have their stuff together-- which was important to me considering how much I forked over for the classes! Like Elizabeth said, they don't have a private lot but there is a parking garage attached to the building and metered parking right outside (it's Coral Gables, they can't magically construct a parking lot out of thin air).

The front desk staff is comprised mostly of young girls whom would rather not be there, so if you have to interact with them keep it brief and be your own advocate. Do not expect them to know what you are talking about because 1) their iphones need attending to and 2) they have so many different classes offered that they just can't keep up!

Nevertheless, the materials are top-notch and if you are lucky enough to get Erik, you will be in great shape! When I decided grad school was where I really wanted to be I didn't lose a minute contemplating where I would prep for the GRE--you got it, Kaplan!

P.S. The online components are second to none. Do yourself and your future a favor...you're on the comp right now! That's right!

review.author: Rafael M.
review.description: I am outraged with Kaplan. Twice my sister in law has come to me complaining of the racial slurs given by these so called "instructors". It is unacceptable that in 2014 this behavior still take place. These instructors need to be fired.

review.author: Elizabeth T.
review.description: Just wanted to point out - this isn't just a language school. I'm currently enrolled in an LSAT prep class here!\n\nThe center is REALLY nice and it's a great place to take a course. At first I was bummed because my class was moved here from the University of Miami, but I'm actually really happy with the location. The only downside is the parking - you have to park either in the garage (which is attached to the building, so it's convenient) or on the street. It just bothers me that Kaplan doesn't validate parking (you can run across to Nordstrom and get a coffee at the E-Bar and get it validated, but then you still end up paying something for the coffee).

review.author: Uy H.
review.description: Hi! i am international student. i come from Viet Nam. before i studied at Ohlone college in california. do you have ELI program for international student? Can i apply your school. i would like to receipt your response. Thank you

review.author: Jason M.
review.description: I have taken Mandarin from Wanda Shaw and the teachers at Yuwenbon for a number of years. Yuwenbon uses the Zhuyin method of teaching Mandarin. Once you free yourself of the boundaries of the English language and rules that govern it, you will find Mandarin actually quite easy to learn and the Zhuyin method will provide you with the absolute correct method of pronunciation for the language. Pinyin's romanization of Mandarin causes native English speakers to mispronounce words and struggle with the tones. After learning Mandarin through Zhuyin, you will sound like a native speaker and have a fundamental understanding of Mandarin and all of its nuances (cultural and modern). I cannot recommend Wanda Shaw's program enough.

review.author: Neil F.
review.description: Yuenbon uses time-proven teaching methods, not relying on the modernist techniques used in the mainland. The end result is a very native-sounding pronunciation. As with all studies, the more effort expended by the student, the better and faster outcome. Wanda has collected a large stock of resources for independent or assisted study.\n\nThe facility is clean, large and well appointed having plenty of restrooms.

review.author: k w.
review.description: Huntsville Chinese Village and Ms. Wanda are excellent resources for learning Chinese.  Both are tremendous assests to the community.  Language classes of various levels are offered for children and adults.  She is even going to offer Chinese dance and calligraphy classes.\n\nBeginners are welcome and can feel at ease.  Ms. Wanda is patient and supportive of her students.  I highly recommend Huntsville Chinese Village.  They have a website you can check out to see for yourself.

review.author: Johnathon W.
review.description: I love it! I'm in there play the music man ind its super fun! Also lets say there's a play that has kissing in it, but you don't want your child in it because of that, they have a younger version of the play so they can still act! Also, no matter what if you sign your kid up, he WILL be in the play. No, "Hes not a good actor" or, "Hes not a good singer" its a great thing to be in. Also I saw the other review and it said her kid was bullied. Thats only because the kid is a jerk. Some kids are jerks, teach your kid that thats life and to get over it. I was hated at my school because ONE poupular kid didnt like me. But I got over it. I didnt like him either or anyone else who hated me. So yeah. I love it.

review.author: Darin B.
review.description: This place is not very supportive of special needs children and administers very disproportionate responses the the slightest of infractions. We have sent our child to their camp on a couple of occasions without incident, she in fact enjoyed the experience. The latest time, she was teamed up on by a few other girls for being too loud and interrupting, something I had explained to the teacher she has a hard time controlling. When she verbally warned one of the other kids to stop, they sent her home for the rest of the week with no further warning, or remedial action. Surely, a kids words shouldn't be cause enough for expulsion, especially when they are only responding to organized criticism from the other kids. We will never, ever subject our kid to this kind of elitist environment again. And it is too bad, since there really isn't another theater option for kids in Huntsville. I think theater camp would be a great place for loud, assertive children. It was for me when I was a loud and assertive kid. Fantasy playhouse is just not able or willing to accommodate such children.

review.author: Heather B.
review.description: We have taken our whole family to several shows and the kids have absolutely loved it!  The classes are a lot of fun too.

name: The University of Alabama In Huntsville

review.author: Ashley S.
review.description: I had to go here to take a proctored exam. It was pretty easy to find where I was going using Waze. There was plenty of parking. The building opens fairly early, so I was able to go in and use the bathroom and find a place to study beforehand. The princess was smooth. They had lockers and locks available to store your stuff. No issues.

review.author: Melissa B.
review.description: I am unsure where to begin, is it the horrible parking problem, to the staff saying "They don't care deal with it". More then half the students here on more then (sad to say) once have been let down and hard by this college. At least 90% do to the colleges office staff. The college regardless of what it tries to portray IS NOT a walking friendly college. The parking situation is a nightmare. And staff is (in their words) Don't care.\n\nI'm out.

review.author: Gordon M.
review.description: The Yale of the Smoky Mountains.......The Harvard of the BBQ Trail.\nLove it!.

review.author: Ben A.
review.description:
This review regards campus police only;

Between my 3 vehicles, I have probably racked over 100 unpaid parking tickets. 

One would think I parked inside a classroom, or plowed down the library to park my car, or illegally parked in a handicapped/ reserved spot. Nope. None of these things. I get ticketed with every visit by simply using a regular old parking space: manditory work conferences, campus visits, exhibition openings. Just be a regular old guy trying to support the community, such shame!

Sometimes during a work conference, I'm blessed enough to receive multiple tickets. Oh joy! I'll be paying all these with monopoly money.

review.author: J. G.
review.description:
I've come to expect from the public universities that you might as well plan on not getting the "best" experience. Certainly better than most community colleges, but still lacking in a lot of regards. While I was attending Dr. "Sean Connery" Williams was heading the school, and it has become apparent that the UAH board was all about the money. Forcing full time students to get a crappy meal plan and other such nonsense to support their add-ons. Meaning a half Chick-fil-a, and a gas station-like convenience. Nevermind chick-fil-a is a block away from the school so are gas stations. 

Anyways, it is just apparent that they need to work on their care of the students. I was lucky enough to have great starting advisers (Freshman - Sophomore engineering); however, liberal arts department is sorely lacking a great set of advisers.

School isn't overly hard, but definitely harder than a community college and my attendance at UNA. I feel I got a great education despite the complaints above. The school has a lot of perks and cheap living expenses compared to some college towns. I would continue schooling there. Great place for internships.

review.author: Brandon L.
review.description: Came to The University of Alabama in Huntsville for a piano recital so the only building I was in was the music ones. It seems ok. That is all.

review.author: SphiX ..
review.description: Well this is my first semester at UAH and I have to say its not what I thought it would be.  I guess its because I came from a small community college and I'm just not used to this big of a work load.  The teachers overall are pretty good.  My Engineering Economy teacher is awesome!  But I have a Physics lab professor that speaks maybe 2 words of English and is horrible at giving instructions (which is pretty important considering its a LAB!!).  UAH has a lot of good clubs and activities but most of the people here are not as friendly as I have seen in most places.   But overall its a very good university, and they have great engineering programs here.  I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

review.author: Lynn C.
review.description: Wonderful school with caring and supportive staff, my children could not be in a better place.  I love their current initiative to become a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive school.

review.author: DM M.
review.description: Y'all really need to do something when students come forward with a problem. When a kid comes to you saying they are having bullying problems, you didn't do anything! And that was after many, many discussions with her advisor.  She was so unwelcome by the students is was horrific! I would never send my kid there again.

review.author: Edgar D.
review.description: Seeking Truth Building Character Nurturing All.\n\nAfter almost ten years at Randolph, my daughter is ready, willing to take on the world of college.  The college counseling is a big plus at Randolph.  The school works hard to find the right fit for each student.

review.author: Becca G.
review.description: This is a fantastic pottery studio in the outskirts of Wildwood, which is beautiful! I had a great time at the Friday Night Social and love the platter I made!

review.author: Aimee I.
review.description: This is the most beautiful pottery studio that I have ever had the pleasure to take a class in.  The instructors are very talented and friendly.  I have already learned in a month, several new techniques I did not learn in four years of classes in other studios.  The best of the best equipment.  The studio itself is beautiful, roomy and comfortable.  Best thing happening in West County, or really in all of St Louis County.

review.author: Pamela M.
review.description:
I had a good experience at Calhoun back when. I attended Calhoun when they had satellite campuses all over the place. The main campus was (and I guess still is) in Decatur, and yes you had to attend a lot of classes there; however, they also had satellite classrooms on Redstone Arsenal, Huntsville High School and in "THE Mall" - yes where Barnes and Noble is now, only further down the mall - you had to hang a left at the western themed bar and it was on the east side of The Mall where Picadilly used to be. We always joked that if you leaned in closely enough to the cinder walls you could still hear the servers saying "Serve you, Serve you please?!?!?!" :D

Because high school was such a breeze for me and really did not prepare me for college, I started UAH with a whopping 1.0 and yes, academic probation my first semester. I had no idea you could drop a class and really did *not* think the professors meant what they said when they assigned voluminous amounts of reading/coursework with only a day or so to accomplish it, and I paid for it with terrible grades my first semester.

Enter Calhoun! Calhoun to the rescue! I took classes all over north Alabama or at least it felt like it with part time college professors and full time ones, too. Anyway, it was still hard work; however the staff were friendlier than UAH, more accommodating to those of us who worked, and had more of a smaller, diverse group of students. I still learned and I learned a LOT at Calhoun!

I managed to pull my grades up to graduate with two associates at cum laude and transfer back to UAH to do the same with 1 BA cum laude.

The tip for anyone planning to do a similar approach to getting a degree is to stay in touch with UAH and ensure each class and associated credit *will* transfer from Calhoun to UAH. To me, and I'm sure to any college student, these hours are pretty much worth gold and you don't want to lose them! Also, don't be afraid to take any issues where a credit is denied to the Dean (or higher if necessary) to argue your case. Pay attention to the handbooks (if that's a thing anymore) and ensure the classes align in terms of course content.

Oh, and another good thing about Calhoun is you don't rack up 1000s of parking tickets by attending there.

review.author: Marisa G.
review.description: Don't use the vending machines...ever. You're better off going to the gas station next door.

review.author: Jonathan A.
review.description: I used to go here seven days a week, training with my marine recruit buddy. I continued to do so for another year or so and then the gym got rid of my favorite machine: the bench press which couldn't drop weight on you. I went from benching 140 to 275 using it, I loved it, and then it was gone.\n\nIt seems like a simple reason to leave, but between that and the rowing machines I was done.

review.author: Josh B.
review.description: I am an alumni. If you aren't, expect 100 bucks the first month, if you are 40$. They will shut down all the courts for third parties without any notice, and they are only open 4 hours on Sunday. Forget that.

review.author: Fernando P.
review.description: As a student I have a free membership. I like how clean the gym is as opposed to others I have been to. Furthermore, most of the staff is friendly and nice and the equipment is pretty solid. \n\nI will say that some of the treadmills seem to not work sometimes which can be frustrating, but besides that I haven't had a problem with any other machine. The gym is pretty big and spacious unlike other places so that's a big win for me. I will say that I have had some not so pleasant experiences with a few employees who were rude to me.

review.author: Cole B.
review.description: This place is awful. I went here to play basketball with three of my FRIENDS who I have been around with the last 3 months and the employees said I could not play basketball with them. Only 2 at a time on a full court. I also went to the gym and apparently you can not use a bar with 2.5 pounds in each side (warm up set)  without couplings holding the weights without getting yelled at.

review.author: Jeffrey R.
review.description: As a student, I have head an excellent experience. Everything is clean, the staff are nice and friendly. The new director is a great guy. All maintenance issues are handled within a reasonable amount of time. The fit techs are super helpful.

review.author: Emily G.
review.description: Being a student at UAH, I get a free gym membership because I'm a full time student. The gym is very convenient in between classes. The equipment was replaced within this year and its really nice. However, with all the new equipment, the weight room is super crowded, and during lunch hours and after work hours it makes it a lot worse.

review.author: Sarina V.
review.description: TERRIBLE. THE LADY THERE IS SO RUDE!!!\nThey have these stupid rules where you have to be 19 to be allowed to use the equipment without parent consent, and I am 20, but my brother is turning 19 in a month. Random age for this rule, I thought 18 was an appropriate age and you are considered an adult then, didn't know they made there own stupid rules. We called ahead and asked and everything seemed fine, so we drove all the way to the gym...and they didn't even tell us...we got there and she's like you need parent consent. This made me really mad when she could've mentioned this detail over the phone or made an exception this time since we called ahead. Also, for a guest pass its 10 dollars....WHAT A RIP OFF. The smoothies are way overpriced as well, and the equipment is CRAP AND OLD....find a better gym to go too...the people there aren't nice!!!

review.author: Autumn S.
review.description: Not sure what is going on with the front staff but they have actually been smiling at patrons and acknowledging me when I check in!  Service has definitely improved and classes and instructors are still awesome.

review.author: Chace K.
review.description: Update: been here for about 4 years, still great.  They recently bought all new machines, 2 more sets of bumper plates and chains.  However they no longer allow the use of chalk.

review.author: John B.
review.description: Poor equipment and rude staff.  People at the front desk and smoothie bar always acted like they were doing me a favor.

review.author: Lacey T.
review.description: I love this gym! The facility is so nice. The equipment in the weight room is all brand new. My only complaint is that the weight room get's extremely crowded, but that's what happens when you have a great gym!

review.author: Jack W.
review.description: Good school has it ups and down it could use a new principal but that's about it I loved it when I went there

review.author: Will B.
review.description: Huntsville High is a great school with tough classes, caring teachers, and a supportive community.  There is something for everyone - clubs, academic teams, sports, and arts.  It's an inspiring place to learn!  My only complaint is that there isn't enough time in the day to do everything I want to get involved in.

review.author: William H.
review.description:
Best CPR instruction ever!   The instructor knows his stuff and makes the material easy to learn and, more important, easy to retain.  Excellent educational equipment and personal instruction that is usable and easy to understand.

This is not one of those on-line classes that gives you a meaningless certificate and an empty wallet.  All facets of BLS, PALS, and ACLS taught with useful insights and practical Information.

Office provides the support for classes and documentation when needed.

My preferred provider for CPR instruction.  This outstanding service is used by many healthcare organizations in our community.

review.author: Aldo Javier S.
review.description: Thank you very much for all the help they gave me. I am very happy to have belonged to Tutoring Gables. Their great teachers especially Mr. Carlos helped me a lot in the SAT / ACT exams. I really have no words, they are the best. Thank you so so so so much!!!!!!!!!!!!

review.author: Maria G.
review.description: For as long as I can remember I struggled with math, until i discovered Gables Tutoring. The tutors there are really friendly and will be patient with you to make sure you understand everything you need to know, whether it's for your math class or for tests like the ACT or SAT. No other tutor I've worked with was nearly as helpful. Since i started going to Gables Tutoring, I've been able to maintain an A in math and my SAT math section score has gone up more than 120 points... Highly recommend this place to anyone, whether you don't understand anything at all or just need someone to go over your homework with you!

name: ICS Coral Gables | Daycare & Private Preschool

review.author: Michelle O.
review.description: I can't say enough about this school. Had to go back to work 2 and a half months after giving birth and I couldn't find a nanny that I felt comfortable with. I was going nuts looking for childcare for my tiny baby when someone recommended this school. On my first visit, I knew this was the place for my baby. Clean, loving environment. Director Janice de Armas walks you through everything and is always patient with my "new mommy" questions. Also, She runs a tight ship as far as security measures go to make sure the campus is secure. The campus is gorgeous and has a good energy about it. Teachers are caring and very knowledgeable in their field. My son started at 2.5 months and is now a thriving, sociable 2year old, and I know ICS has played an important role in that.

review.author: Annette B.
review.description: International Children's School has been an extension of our family. We are so pleased with the love they show my son. The director, Janice De Armas, shows great devotion to providing amazing programs geared toward early intervention, sensory integration and outstanding education for our children. She has gone above and beyond in ensuring her teachers and staff are properly trained and implementing only the best sensory education which are not only fun for our children but extremely educational! I couldn't ask for a better second home for my baby boy! Thank you ICS! We love you!

review.author: Christina M.
review.description: My daughter started ICS before she could even walk. Now she is 3 years old and amazes me every single day. ICS Coral Gables and Janice De Armas, the director, are a big part of the reason my daughter has excelled in the way she speaks, behaves and continues to develop. Potty training our daughter has been the most difficult of tasks, ICS and Janice and her teachers stepped in to save the day. They have worked with our daughter and have been patient and caring with her needs. We are so incredibly blessed to have found this gem. I recommend this school to anyone with kids from newborn to 5 years old. Not only is it a great school, but the sense of family and community that they staff creates for the parents is bar none. Thanks ICS. We are forever grateful.

address.streetAddress: 358 San Lorenzo Ave\nSte 3205 - Fl 3\nShops of Merrick Park

review.author: Yara V.
review.description: My baby loves coming to Gymboree. She has been coming since she was 5 months and I wish I would have brought her sooner. She is 11 months now and still loves it! Great teachers, super friendly and nice!\n\nMs. Samantha is great and Kelly is also amazing!! Sad that Ms. Linda had to go. She was the sweetest of all . Miss Georgie is soooo nice and pretty :).

review.author: Laura H.
review.description: This place is a joke. My husband went in today for the first time with my baby thats 20 month old and the lady in the front desk(nicole) was very rude said shes not having him in the class. Didnt even ask if we needed help or anything she just started screaming, and it was our first time inside the place. This is not i place i would recommend to any parents for their little one. So rude and unprofessional

review.author: Kyla-Emman N.
review.description: Gymboree is one of the few nice places to bring your child for a class. It's located in Merrick Park mall which has tons of parking (park on level 3 for ease). Gymboree is always clean and the instructors are very nice. Classes are for ages 0-5, with both parent participation and drop off classes available.

review.author: Yenney D.
review.description: Estoy tan agradecida por a ver encontrado esta escuelita para mi nino , el ama a sus teacher y difruta al maximo con sus amigos , una atencin espectacular y mi nino cada dia aprende mas lo llevo desde sus 5 meses y si supiera lo hubiera llevado antes. Gracias miss ana , miss lucy y Nicole por hacernos sentir como en casa.

review.author: Susan P.
review.description: My daughter enjoys her classes.  Miss Lucy is excellent!  Cleanliness is good.  Nicole can be rude and unwelcoming at times which takes away from the experience.

review.author: Alexandra R.
review.description: Beyond amazing!  Kind teachers and staff. My daughter loves going to the crawlers class.

review.author: Claudia R.
review.description: Rudeness and antipatic personnel attending customers is beyond any possible comprehension. Why people like that are even hired?\nMiami is already famous for horrible customer service, but this place easily wins #1 position.

review.author: Chabela R.
review.description: I almost didn't sign up my toddler because of the bad reviews but I think it's a great class. It's nicely structured but not so uptight with the kids. The teacher Lucy is super sweet and the owner is normal, quiet but normal.  I really like it and we'll continue going. I don't usually write reviews but this place definitely doesn't deserve 1 star reviews, I'm glad I went so my baby can develop more skills there.

review.author: Kary D.
review.description: Our son has been part of the School Skills program this summer and I just want to say how happy we are that we enrolled him. He is not only learning and having fun, but the most important part for us is how happy he wakes up every morning and looks forward to going to Gymboree!! Thank you to the amazing staff for everything!!

review.author: Michelle L.
review.description: I've been here before for the open play with no issues but today I had invited a few moms to join me. I had double checked the times online and sent it out to my friends. Showed up today and they told me "unfortunately the times online aren't right. Open play is over, sorry." No offer to extend the open play, just shrugged shoulders like "too bad I guess." Obviously the other moms and I aren't coming back.

review.author: M M.
review.description: Horrible experience today at the Gymboree in Coral Gables. This was the first time my daughter attended the preschool steps. From the moment we arrived we were treated poorly by staff. We were not greeted, not even asked if it was our first time or not. Not one staff member guided us on what we needed to do. I waited for a little bit and then decided to follow another parent who was dropping their child off. I saw that they wrote their child's name on a name tag so I did the same for my daughter. I then took her in and the teacher said in these exact words "did you say goodbye to your daughter?". I then stepped back, nervous and worried that I might have made the wrong decision of handing my daughter to some strangers who did not even take the time to greet us and help us on our first time at this Gymboree. I stood out of the play area but stayed in the store looking in for a few seconds to make sure my daughter wasn't crying. Then suddenly another staff member pointed the door at me and said "you need to leave now!" I then said to her "I'm just worried about my daughter, it's her first time here and I just want to make sure she transitions well." The staff member then responded in a very cold matter; "I cannot let the other kids see another parent in here." I was in total disbelief. I could not believe the way I was treated. I left the Gymboree class worried and stressed. I do not want to drop my daughter off next week and I am now regretting signing up for this month's membership.

review.author: Leila A.
review.description:
Don't go here unless you want to get yelled at by the manager in front of your children (and all the other parents and kids). Nicole Goudie, the manager, was unbelievably rude to me when I came in with my daughter to make up a class we missed due to the hurricane. She wouldn't listen to me, talked over me, and then called me rude as I stood there embarrassed in the gym with my kid. When she finally stopped yelling at me and realized she was in the wrong, she didn't apologize. I was 20 mins late to the class because she accosted me... some "make up" class that was. 

Nicole did the same thing to my friend when she had her kid's birthday party there -- accused her of "talking over" her while arguing and interrupting her customer. So disrespectful.

Apparently Nicole doesn't need to curb her attitude towards customers because she's the franchise owner's daughter and has job security through nepotism. So, I don't think things will change anytime soon. Best to go to another location not Goudie-owned (Kendall, Palmetto Bay, and Coral Gables) or try other places like Silly Monkeys Playhouse in Coconut Grove.

review.author: Thu Real C.
review.description: I just love ny gymbo experience.. the staff was amazing.. super helpful  and lovely. The are freat with kid, my daugther learn so much in her clases at gym. Learn how to socialize  with other kids, she lear to share her toy with the ither also. Having just one kid was  really for her doing that little thing, but going to gymbo clases  helper her it so many was. And help me to have so relief. In so glad to be part of gymbo family.

review.author: Nadya G.
review.description: My son really enjoyed his classes! It's a great way to get your child socialize and safely practice to climb, use stairs etc! Totally recommend!
