My mother died from cancer in 1995 and I remember my father saying that he believed she might have been exposed to the asbestos that was in the building my family lived in in the early 1990s (Smith Hall).

My father was a whistleblower who blew the whistle on MTSU for exposing students to asbestos. He was a David who fought Goliath and lost. My mother died a few months before this article was written. How could my father tolerate a legal battle after losing his wife to cancer? I don't know. I want people to know what happened to him. He will not have died in vain because I am still alive to tell his story.

review.author: Rashaan S.
review.description: I transferred to this school as a History major with 98 credit hours. I was in the Army so that's the reason for the transfer. They, the History department, did not want to give me credit for my previous work. My past classes were superior to what they offered--using the department heads words. Additional, while taking a 3d art elective. I was accused by the instructor of sexual harassment for a female student who was interested in me and I politely rebuffed (she was just unattractive). The student didn't initiate the complaint the instructor did. I had to insure an evasive process for 3 months to pure my innocence. The student in question testified on my behalf. The instructor was not given a contact renewal. Don't attend this school. It unprofessional. MTSU is a Boomer culture not an educational institution. The History profs knowledge was antiquated at best. MTSU is a waste of money, time and a 1 star rating.

review.author: glenn s.
review.description: So I decided to go back to school and complete my degree after a 24 year absence.  I was very nervous and apprehensive about my return being an older student.  The Staff and Faculty were very accommodating and welcoming.  They worked hard to help me and made the transition simple.  The students didn't even blink an eye at the old guy.  Several even made it a point to befriend me (no, not to buy them beer) and that really made me feel welcome at the University.  As far as the education, well with all the new technology it was very easy for an old guy like me.  They provide all the resources and help you could possibly need.  The campus has been redesigned to accommodate the student, making them comfortable and providing them all the help they need.  If you dont understand, just ask and you will get the help.

review.author: Jeremy S.
review.description:
MTSU is a kind of like an Olympic athlete with OCD dressed as a new age street bum; it's not immediately obvious to anyone that crosses paths with MTSU, but with time it becomes apparent that this is a really good school. 

Pros:
HUGE University with tons of amenities
Many national highly ranked teams (debate, ROTC, etc.)
Excellent colleges
Large student population with something for everyone

Cons:
It's always growing so there is a seemingly endless amount of construction disrupting daily life.
It's also a state school, which affords students cheap in-state tuition but also means large amounts of state bureaucracy.

Overall, with its huge selection of programs & degrees coupled with cheap tuition and some amazing departments, I'd definitely recommend studying at MTSU.

review.author: Ava B.
review.description: Great school. Graduation Pamphlet got caught on my lips. It made a huge cut inside my lip. Obviously too much sap. 3.5 stars

review.author: Lauren P.
review.description: I was here this evening for my brother's high school graduation, and I was pleasantly surprised at how big and comfy this venue was! It was pretty immaculate as far as cleanliness goes, and the seats were super comfy. I had never even heard of this college before, but they have so many awards on display and seem to be creating great students. Plus, the campus is MASSIVE. Not one thing about this place is small country at all.

review.author: Misti W.
review.description: Where do I begin? This school has an instructor that her husband is the Dean of the department. This particular instructor seems to enjoy failing students and offers little to no help through the semester. I would recommend any other school in the area before MTSU and especially if you plan on going to nursing school. Oh and I might mention this instructor I speak of, is the only one who teaches this required class.

review.author: Hope D.
review.description: This campus is huge and for a newbie can be hard to navigate.  But, the grounds are clean and the advisers / staff are very helpful and friendly. They seem to get things done in a timely manner. \nParking is difficult if you do not have a decal and the parking enforcement are out for blood! \nI'll update my review as I continue my first semester.

review.author: Ren G.
review.description:
This was a good starter University. It's a fun place to be a freshman, and have your first college experience. I got my undergraduate degree here in Biology. I still remember the smell of the biology building--I was grossed out at first but now that smell makes me kind of feel comfortable and warm, haha.

Anyone who is considering this University and has visited will know, it's huge. There are about a million buildings and as one professor said, they're still "Building the empire."

One of the things about MTSU that really sets it apart is a program that just recently began called MTeach. If you're in the market for your degree in teaching, this is the ONLY University in Tennessee that offers this, and I would recommend them very highly. If you want to be a teacher, DO NOT stay at home and go to community college for two years to save money! Start Mteach your freshman year and you will not regret it! It is the most hands on curriculum for teaching teachers. The lady who is presently in charge of it is Sally Millsap, whose contact information can be found on MTSU's website, and she is an absolute treasure. All of the staff at MTeach are there for you 100% and will give you the individual attention you would not expect from such a large school.

That said, advising here blows. You aren't going to get good advice from your advisor and you might as well sit down with a course catalog and work out your four year plan by yourself. Maybe have a professor in your department check it, but don't plan on getting a lot of help. Use your common sense!!!

One of my biggest regrets from my undergrad is not living on campus. MTSU has several dorms that are practically brand new and it's like a sleepover party every night. My friend lived in one of the dorms and her whole floor was full of girls who became close friends and I wish I'd had that experience.

As far as dining goes, if you don't have the stomach for normal cafeteria stuff, don't buy a meal plan unless they force you to. If you do eat on campus, go to JUB. ALWAYS JUB. And try to go around 10:30. They're going to charge you for breakfast but you can stay until 11 when they start serving lunch. Grab waffles, cereal, and some pizza on the way out. And don't miss the MTSU chocolate milk. They make it on campus with the farming students and it is the best chocolate milk I have ever experienced.

I give MTSU three stars because it's A-OK. That is exactly how I would describe it. You get what you need for an undergraduate degree. It isn't as high tech as some of the schools in California (except perhaps for the student health building) but it is the best price in the state for a degree. Live on campus for at least your first two years. Trust me. And then move out into your own place if you're ready. Murfreesboro is cheap. There are plenty of things wrong with this place, but if I had to go back and do it all over, I wouldn't change University's.

review.author: Zachary N.
review.description: The school itself was fine but the treatment and attitude of the faculty towards a military dependent and brother of two mtsu alum was horrible. Glad to not be going there

review.author: Cole M.
review.description:
Ah, my Alma Mater, such a lovely campus and one of the last truly education based schools in the Southeast.  If you go here you won't get a free ride, it's not easy and you will have to study to make it through to the end and get that diploma.  The professors here are first rate and some of the most laid back easy going people you'll meet, if you communicate with them you'll get a first rate education at mid range prices too.  

The area around here is kind of expensive but the school is not, you'll also find that it's a very safe campus and somewhere you can walk freely being yourself without being ridiculed or judged by others.  That being said this is one of the best schools in the Southeast in my opinion.  I've visited friends at other schools and believe me, they are not in such great neighborhoods and you will be surprised at the cost difference and the disappoint my friends feel after visiting MTSU.  

I am proud to have gone here and I'm also glad it wasn't a cakewalk, you earn your degree here and it makes you a better person in the process.

review.author: Claire B.
review.description:
I write this as a graduate of MTSU. I went to several different colleges throughout my undergraduate education and MTSU was my favorite and it's difficult to tell you why. 

At MTSU, there are many classes I've taken in many different subjects that were absolutely fantastic and I learned so much in. The university is big enough that unusual classes are offered in almost every major. 

My graduate major was English and my entire graduate experience was fantastic. I gained so much experience teaching and those mentoring me ran a great program that allowed students to gradually progress to teaching and gave us the tools we needed to be successful.

review.author: Eric S.
review.description: This is a fantastic place to go to school! I am a senior now and have made so many friends in my classes that I can study with and succeed with. They have a lot of high quality professors as well! I am an exercise science major and MTSU is known for having an excellent program for that!

review.author: Charles S.
review.description: It's cheap for in-staters. It's got some pretty good professors, but it's generally quantity over quality. The College of Mass Communications is one of the best in the country. \n\nAll that said, it's a huge commuter school, so parking SUCKS! Did I mention it's cheap for in-staters?

review.author: Jessica B.
review.description:
Parking will always be the biggest pain for most students, especially since construction and student housing parking have been implemented. There's always construction on campus, it's inevitable.

I'm a sophomore at MT but I won't be graduating from there due to the fact they do not have my major. Advisors/ staff experience all depends on your major and how much you bug them about your issues. Bigger departments, such as financial aid and admissions, have always been accessible and helpful during my time as a student.

I'm usually always on the older side of campus so I don't often get to see the buildings/ construction my tuition dollars has helped fund. The student union building is very nice and there are a lot of food options located within, as well as across campus. My biggest complaint is the fact that MTSU puts so much money into the newer parts of the campus while older buildings get worse by the year. I practically live in the KOM (oldest building on campus) during the semester and it's falling apart slowly but surely. The AC is either freezing you out of the class or not working at all. The windows rattle during any kind of wind event and lady bugs invade when the weather changes.

Overall, I like MTSU. While I wish they offered my major so I didn't have to move to an entire different state, we can't all have what we want. I will continue to finish my
general credits here until the inevitable move. I hope that with the addition of the new parking garages and construction all around campus, it will continue to be pretty easy to navigate and accommodating to those students enrolling each semester.

review.author: Trevor D.
review.description: MTSU was a great school for me. I finished my last two years of undergrad and stayed around for my MBA. I spend a lot of time in the BAS building. For the price you pay, its a great education. Do youself, family, and future family a huge favor and find a place with instate tuition from a public school. I was debt free with all schooling two years after graduation. Hope this helps.

review.author: Chelsea P.
review.description: I will forever miss my days at MTSU. I owe this place big time for a lot of great memories, breezy days out in the quad, library naps, and debates in Peck Hall. Beautiful campus and people. Love.

review.author: Janet S.
review.description: Visiting the Electronic Media and Mass Communication Department to see where some of the fantastic employees I have had over the last few years have come from.  Dept is 800 with a wonderful Chair of Dept and Assistant Director of Video Facilities (one of my former employees).  It is a department well maintained with first class facilities and equipment, studios.  Make sure you get parking pass or you will be clamped or towed.  Set in old Murfreesboro - quite delightful surroundings.

review.author: Stacy A.
review.description: There's no better way to beat the heat than to hit the pool! Prairie Grove Aquatic Park has a walk-in entry pool with two water slides that's a fun and affordable option for your family visiting in the summer months.

review.author: Patricia H.
review.description: Great family atmosphere. A nice all-day outing. Something for everybody, lots of lifeguards, nice diving and slide areas, great concession stand and area. Reasonably priced!

review.author: Roxanne T.
review.description: Excellent pizza. My mouth waters just thinking about it. Fast and efficiient service.

review.author: Miana B.
review.description: the park is very fun and clean! good is great too, although there is fiber glass on the slides and it hurts! please if anything don't go on the slides!!

review.author: Nico D.
review.description: In the summer we bring the kids here about once per week in addition to swim lessons and swim team practice that also meet here. Great place and staff. Always clean.

review.author: Stephanie F.
review.description: This is a great asset to such a small town. The park is pretty new, which means it's also clean. Because it is a small town it is never really packed. They have two medium sized water park slides; a beach-style pool with two smaller slides and a diving board; and a toddler pool with a waterfall-type thing. \nThe only complaint I have is that there is very little shade. Two of the tables have umbrella's. They could really use a shade structure of some kind. \nYou can bring floats for babies and toddlers. I think noodles are okay, too.

name: Tender Care Day Care Center of Roland

review.author: Carri Z.
review.description: I absolutely love miro! I was nervous to start my son at 2 and they made it so much easier. The teachers really care and love the children. The best school I could of chosen & my son loves it!

review.author: Lauren M.
review.description:
Me ENCANTA Mir! As a first-time parent, Mir International Preschool meets all my needs in that every single person there is naturally loving, has a desire to teach, and takes my child's health and development seriously. For me, the fact that they are a full Spanish immersion program is just an added bonus ;)

I enrolled my son when he was 14 months old. His social and verbal skills have blossomed in these first few months. He adores his teachers, Maestra Ofelia and Maestra Rosy. Every morning when I drop him off, Ofelia greets him with her warming smile and embrace. No tears here! I am also updated throughout the day via an app that lets me know what he's doing that day. 

The school coordinator, Andrea has been wonderful communicating back and forth with me from the moment I met her. I've had a lot of questions and requests and she's always been so accommodating! She greets every parent and child by name-which again, reiterates my point of every single person there cares! 

Overall, my son and I are very happy being a Mir family. We look forward to many happy pre-k years together!

review.author: Jennifer R.
review.description: We feel so blessed to have found Mir for our son. The school came highly recommended, from multiple Independent sources, for the curriculum,  knowledge and dedication of the staff and owner. But what impresses is the most about Mir is the warmth of the staff and the feeling that our 3 year old joined a small community and an environment that feels like family, to help support him. We have had the opportunity to meet such a diverse group of families and love that our son is exposed to all of this at such a young age. I would highly recommend miro to anyone looking for a well rounded education and a nurturing environment for their young children .

review.author: Eric P.
review.description:
We are so happy that we chose Miro as the preschool for our daughter. We had already heard good things from a friend about the school so we enrolled her in part of the summer program after having attended an open house.

Every single person there has a passion for working with children. Walking in each morning our daughter is showered with greetings and hugs. They have a clear curriculum from Spain that they follow, but I am most impressed with their focus on helping to raise polite, caring, and loving children.

Our daughter was over her apprehension within a week and now she can't wait to go play with all of her friends. She is constantly teaching us new songs in Spanish and her language skills have really blossomed (we speak a mixture of English and Spanish at home, but we are not native speakers).

We like the use of the BrightWheel app which keeps us up to date about our daughter's day (and there is at least one new photo of her sent to us daily).

We did look at a few other schools but this one best fit our personality. They provide a wonderful and safe learning environment at Miro!

review.author: Michelle S.
review.description:
TRUSTWORTHY, AFFORDABLE, AMAZING!

This preschool is a DREAM come true. ....and your kid will become fluent it Spanish? Whaaaat?!

I have worked in pre-school-8th grade education my whole life, so I can attest to having seen and heard a lot with regard to childcare, education, communication etc.

Searching for the perfect fit for your child is extremely exhausting.

My number one need as a parent was and is a warm and caring environment with trustworthy people to leave my child. Mro offered that environment to me...and much more.

Fabiana has created a trusting environment with an amazing curriculum and an equally amazing staff to deliver it.  

From the moment I walked into Mro I felt at home.  Talk about accommodating....My daughter was much younger than the other babies, and as a result, at a much different level.  (Not walking, feeding self etc.) the school insisted that I bring her and they would work with me.  One of the teachers actually brought in her college aged daughter to personally care for my daughter so that she could stay at the school.

Also, the school was closing for a week of summer break but I really needed care, so one of the teachers offered to watch all 3 of my girls! 

Amazing! Let me tell you, this stuff just doesn't happen at other places! 

I received regular texts and pictures that let me know how/what the girls were doing.  What a spectacular group of professionals.

Oh and did I mention that the tuition is extremely reasonable?! I used to pay a ridiculous amount of money for a Spanish Immersion school right down the street.

So, if you have been praying for a place that you feel relaxed leaving your child...one that wouldn't leave you thinking about your kids and their well being......              all. day. long..........

LOOK NO FURTHER! This IS the place. 

Michelle Kelly

review.author: Jeff B.
review.description:
Absolutely fantastic school!  We toured at least a half dozen schools and could not be happier with our choice.  Between our two children we've been lucky enough to work with most of the teachers at Miro, and we have nothing but rave reviews for each and every one of them, they're genuinely loving people who care for our kids like they are their own.  

And the Spanish our children have learned so quickly is amazing, it still blows me away to hear them change back and forth between Spanish and English, depending on who they are talking to.  We don't speak Spanish at home, so everything they've learned has come solely from their time in school.

5+ stars :)

review.author: Nordy L.
review.description: We love Mir! \nThe school is filled with engaged teachers and staff that trully want to make a difference in our kids life. Kids are exposed to a variety of activities with a purpose and have tons of fun. We trust this team and are very excited to be part of it. My boys love going to school and can't stop talking about their teachers, friends and daily activities... in Spanish, of course! There is no better place for your kids to learn at this early age while having fun and feeling so much love.

review.author: Lisa R.
review.description: If you are looking for a SCHOOL and not a daycare that offers a structured curriculum every single day for your little one, look no further than this school, MIRO. We actually stumbled across the school on yelp because we were in search for structured Socialization.  After learning more about what Spanish immersion was and touring the school, we were sold on sending our 2 year old there to get a jumpstart on learning another language, especially because we are in English only speaking household. Our son began attending Miro at 15 months and has been there for less thank one year. He has learned so much Spanish! I've noticed him saying things to me in Spanish that bring me back to when I was in high school and learned a little bit of the language. For example, he opens the fridge and says "papas!" (Potatoes) and points to so many things and will say "aqui!" (Here). He can easily count to 10 in spanish, knows all his facial features in Spanish, and can sing many rhymes and songs in Spanish not to mention easily over 100 words (well probably more, but i need to brush up on my Spanish!!).  The teachers are wonderful. His teacher last year, maestro Betty is phenomenal.  She loves every student as one of her own kids and really cares about their well being and education.  Because my son was so young when he started, and began going to school full time from the start (7:30-3 Monday-Friday) it was a little bit of an adjustment. Betty did not even bat an eye when my son would cry for the first little while every morning i would drop him off. Now he doesn't want to leave school when we go to pick him up! The school is like a family and i would recommend this school to anyone looking for something more than "daycare". If you're looking for a diaper changing babysitter, MIRO IS NOT for you. But if you are wanting the absolute best care, curriculum, structure, education, clean facility, MIRO IS THE PLACE! Go for a tour and meet Fabiana, the owner. I promise you won't regret it. And just because it's a Spanish immersion, doesnt mean it will empty your wallet. You get so much by sending your child to this school, at an extremely reasonable price. You need to go check it out.  It's seriously amazing and I'm so happy to have stumbled across this school for my little one. I know this will be life changing for my son ;) thank you miro!!

review.author: Kenny L.
review.description: My wife and I feel very grateful that we found Miro for our daughter, who is completing her second year.  Not only has her language skills improved but she has also learned to be a responsible and caring person.  Miro offers a wonderful learning environment.  Fabiana, the school director, sets the overall tone for the school and her ability to hire teachers who are just as warm and caring as she is really what sets this school apart from others that we've visited.  We would recommend Miro to any of our friends looking for a preschool for their little one.

review.author: Stephanie R.
review.description: Both of my children went through Spanish preschool from the ages of 2-5 with all of these teachers. As a former Elementary School Teacher I chose Spanish Immersion because I know of the benefits to expand and enhance brain development. We do not speak Spanish at home, so it is wonderful to see our children realize our dreams. The teachers are loving and they strive to offer a rich curriculum. Now they have the chance with the SIRABUN educational model. If you want a preschool that will have your child exit with a strong working knowledge of Spanish, and also be loved and nurtured, this school will meet your expectations.

review.author: Megan M.
review.description: I am so glad that we found this preschool! My son was in a daycare for 4 painful days before we started at Miro, and thankfully we were able to quickly get him out of daycare and into this preschool! Our daycare experience was AWFUL, and making the switch to Miro made such a HUGE difference in his life! This is a preschool, not a daycare, with designated teachers and a structured curriculum. It is very obvious that the teachers and all of the staff truly care about the children. They maintain open communication, post pictures and updates in the app daily, and actively engage the children in various activities. My son is SO much happier attending Miro, and I love that he gets to participate in various learning activities daily while learning Spanish on top of it! They also host several events for the children, and often involve the parents, which is amazing. At Miro, you feel like part of a family! I would highly recommend Miro. :)

review.author: Noor S.
review.description: Miro international preschool is the best school I have ever enrolled my children in.   The Staff and teachers are like family. They truly love their jobs and you can feel it.  It's a very safe and loving environment. I would recommend this school to anyone looking to have their child in a immersion program that goes over and beyond any preschool!

review.author: Amalia S.
review.description: If you are looking to start your children in a full Spanish Immersion preschool this is the best choice I've found. My husband and myself have looked at different options, since we have 2 preschool aged boys. We had enrolled our child in another "Spanish Enrichment Preschool" where we were not seeing him grow as he has now that he is in Miro Preschool with Maestra Maria. Our 18 month old loves Maestra Evelyn he has started producing words in Spanish which is exciting. We are thankful for all the work and effort that Fabiana has put into this preschool. It is a loving, caring, and educational environment. We love the teachers and are thankful to be in the Miro family.

review.author: Tom G.
review.description: Our two girls have had FANTASTIC experiences with these teachers. The immersion Spanish approach has given them a wide exposure to Spanish language and many aspects of Spanish speaking cultures from many countries. Our older girl, halfway through her 3rd year of immersion asked that we only speak Spanish at home. We were sad and delighted that she had already surpassed our limited Spanish language abilities.  These teachers show a passion for education and love for our girls that makes us comfortable entrusting them with the hearts and minds of our little ones.

review.author: Rita B.
review.description: I recently enrolled my 1 year old son at Miro, after pulling him out of a large corporate daycare chain. I was very disillusioned with the childcare system after witnessing the lack of care and love offered by these large multi-state facilities. Enter Miro, I found Miro by searching for a boutique style preschool. I quickly called for an appointment and met with the dynamic and fantastic owner, Fabiana. I was also introduced to Evelyn who would become my sons teacher. I use the word teacher because she teaches my son but teacher does not describe the level of love this wonderful woman shows my son every day. I recently dropped off my little guy who had a rough morning, slept in- little breakfast before we were on our way. Needless to say he was grouchy, but Evelyn embraced him whispering affectionate words in Spanish to him while she cradled him. I left but snuck around back to see this wonderful women holding my son in the playground and having him play and relax. I can't begin to tell you how relived I am to find Miro. My son is thriving in this wonderful environment full of love and laughter. Bravo, Fabiana for bringing this beautiful facility to us and for taking such care in the hiring of your staff.

review.author: Lisa C.
review.description: I Love how Shiloh pours into the kids, and strives to show them a way of excellence! It's definitely worth looking into as a choice of education for your children!

review.author: Thomas N.
review.description: Known as the Washington County Center (WCC), this is the Springdale satellite of Northwest Arkansas Community College. Everything abstract stated in my review of the college as a whole (listed on the Bentonville campus review) extends quite completely to this location. \n\nAs for the concrete, this is a building of several classrooms, where a student living nearby can pick up quite a few credits conveniently. If needing to get to Bentonville, there is a regular bus that goes campus to campus. I wouldn't hesitate to say this location provides an advantage for those students living in Springdale or toward Fayetteville, who needn't travel to Bentonville for every course they take.

review.author: Deb B.
review.description: My little girl started going here at 3 months old up to almost 9 months old.  The only reason we left is because we moved out of the area.  I had no worries dropping my little one off everyday knowing she was loved and cared for and watched over by a well trained staff.  The time we were there the teachers were consistent and I did not see much turnover, just some teachers changing classrooms.  I've never felt so strong about a daycare until my little one just started going to a more expensive/fancier one closer to where we live now and they are nothing like BrightHaven.  BrightHaven seemed to have about a 3:1 or 4:1 ratio with the infants which was great and we were blessed.  The new place we have to take her temporarily does the 6:1 ratio and they can't keep up with all the infants.  It's sad.  We miss BrightHaven and I would highly recommend them to anyone!  They also remember your names and treat you like family, not just another number.

review.author: Qype User (aygu…)
review.description: The University of Stuttgart is an amazing organization in every way and I am very grateful for the incredible opportunity to work here!\nTop-quality educational experience in science, engineering, business, architecture and urban planning, enthusiastic professors, outstanding lectures, amazing intellectual atmosphere.\nBy the way, several graduate degree programs in sciences and engineering are offered in English.

review.author: Qype User (moghar…)
review.description:
Although Uni. Stuttgart is mostly known as the Cradle of the Automobile (which it is) it also has many humane subjects in its downtown campus that are spectacular and besides the top notch science and engineering programs at the Vaihingen campus make up such a prestigious organization so it's no wonder that most graduates from Uni. Stuttgart are employed by Germany's and the world's top corporations.


 It currently ranks among the three top universities in Germany in research and postgraduate studies according to the DAAD website.

review.author: Spencer C.
review.description:
I want to start by saying I am open to adjusting the review if IFA attempts to fix the situation.
I would like to describe my experience here so anyone considering studying here can be aware. I signed up for a B2 Deutschkurs because my other school (AGI) was full. During the sign up process they told me that I would have to take a placement test. So I asked the secretary if I would get my money back if I didn't pass the test (or if I wasn't issued my visa), and she said yes of course. So I sent them the 730€ in good faith and got my visa extended. A few weeks later I took the test, and leaving I felt very confident that I had done well. We would see the results on that Friday.
So my friend who had also taken the test with them goes before me on Friday. He texts me that he had not enough points and they told him that they WOULD NOT be able to give him his money back and he would have to retake B1 with them! They told him that if he wanted to take B2 he could maybe attend the first 3 or 4 days of class and if he was able to keep up they would allow him to continue. These were his only options!
So I was very concerned that they would tell me something similar. I was preparing to demand my money back because I had just finished taking B1 and did very well in the class at AGI. So I rushed over there and asked for my scores. They told me that I also had not scored enough and that I had to retake B1 with them. I asked if I could do the same as my friend and try to attend the first few days and see from there. They told me no! I said they offered it to my friend and they told me his score was probably better than mine but for me it was not possible. Later I found out we had the SAME EXACT SCORE. I said there was no way I am going to retake B1 because I just spent two months doing B1 and how am I supposed to afford this?! These courses are not cheap! After a while of talking to the secretary they agreed to give me some of my money back, but they will charge a 50€ fee! Remember, earlier I had asked specifically if I would be able to get my money back and they said that would be no problem! No one mentioned I would have to argue with them for my money or anything about a fee!
I told my friend that I got my money back and so he was very pissed that they didn't do the same for him. He went back and got his, but he was also charged this 50€. We both signed up for classes at AGI and there was no arbitrarily graded test and none of this drama! They also let us go to the course even though we couldn't pay until IFA finally sent the money back! Very nice of AGI!
Long story short, they gave us each completely different information on two counts - firstly that I could get my money back and he couldn't, and secondly that he could try out the first few days and I couldn't, despite having the same scores. I don't know what this is about! If we hadn't been friends and been able to compare our experiences, we would both have been screwed! I don't know why they are telling people different info, deceiving me by saying there would be no problems getting the money back. All I can say is they want to force some to retake a lower level with them so you end up studying with them longer and they make more money! Not cool!
If anyone is looking for a great language school without any of this drama, I can highly recommend AGI (Anglo German Institute). They are great, friendly, and flexible! They really saved me by making a place for me in B2 after I got screwed over.

review.author: Qype User (russia…)
review.description:
I have been studying German in different schools in the last years and IFA is definitely the best one I've found!!


 Pro's:
+ friendly, young, dynamic environment. 
+ great learning methods: in the lesson there is a bit of grammar, a bit of conversation, a bit of listening... in other words a byte of stuff.
+ actually I like the games that Rennie25 hates: they are made to keep you awake and to practice your pronounce.
+ great book: clear, concise and with a lot of nice pictures :-)


 Con's:
- sometimes the classes are too big, up to 20 persons 
- depending on the teacher that you get, the lessons could be awfully boring or quite interesting...but that's life!

review.author: Qype User (aygu…)
review.description: It's really difficult to find in Stuttgart better place to learn German language than Institut fr Auslandsbeziehungen (Institute of Foreign Cultural Relations): excellent teachers, flexible timetable, intensive, evening and weekend German courses from A1 (elementary level) to C1 (intermediate level)!\nStrongly recommended!

review.author: Qype User (Rennie…)
review.description:
I am not so impressed with ifa as aygul. I have never been to another language school in Stuttgart, but ifa is not a particularly motivating place. Teachers are often grumpy.


 Technology is very low about 1980s..no language lab, not much in supporting audio material or that type of thing, i have never even seen a pc there. Teachers like to play childish games in class that kill time as well.


 The school seems proud of the historic location, but actually it is a construction pit of renovation. It is rather noisy and unpleasant, but it is a short walk from u bahn, so that is a good.


 I would give ifa a C grade. Nothing special. an intensive course is about 20 hours a week, any school should be able to teach something in that amount of time.

review.author: Sam B.
review.description: The worst experience with the most impact on my life. My child didn't accommodate well there and they haven't even try to help. Instead they made a 7!year old feel really demoralized. We left the school and moved back home while my husband is left to finish his contract there. Not to say too much this alone impacted our relationship in worse ways than I though. Yea ISS not a great place if your kid is too active or too outspoken.

review.author: G D.
review.description:
Our daughter has been an ISS student for two years now, with one year in the PYP (Primary Years Program, both at their Sindelfingen and Degerloch campus) and the other in the MYP (Middle Years Program, Degerloch campus).  

For a U.S. government contractor, ISS seemed like a slightly more affordable alternative to DoDDS (Department of Defense Dependence Schools), which costs $24,396 per year vice $17K to $18K per year at ISS; and, unlike at DoDDS, we have never had to worry about our daughter being "bumped out of school" due to over capacity (i.e., space at DoDDS is only guaranteed for children of military and government civilians).  

The IB (International Baccalaureate) program also sounded more admirable in its goal to mold and produce caring, compassionate, global-minded citizens, who are adept at self-motivation and self-education - a goal that greatly resonated with my husband and I.  Unfortunately, this discovery method only works when a student is already very self-driven and/or has access to very thoughtful, innovative teachers; ISS is bereft of the latter, which is why ISS students easily struggle in math and language learning.  For instance, rather than develop individualized learning plans to help students tackle their math and/or language challenges, ISS teachers will instead steer parents towards private tutoring services.

Pros of ISS: Although ISS's community of active parents is small, it is still impressively effective and most likely the reason why ISS continues to remain operational; it has some very caring and kind teachers and staff members, who truly care about the kids; it offers students a unique opportunity to become bilingual and/or trilingual, both through class learning and through immersion trips into neighboring towns; it provides numerous after school programs and a number of overnight school trips to "facilitate holistic learning"; and ISS works hard to build a community of compassionate, tolerant, and open-minded citizens by teaching their students how to appreciate, communicate, and interact with people from different cultures and from other countries.

Cons of ISS: ISS lacks visionaries; it is more reactive than proactive in its strategic and financial planning; many of its managing staff and teachers fail to understand the importance of providing students with strong foundational preparation, especially when it comes to math; lack of a focus on laying foundational knowledge has resulted in many kids falling behind and/or repeating a grade level, once they return to their home countries (most prevalent concern among non-German parents); the principals and teachers are slow at best to respond to your inquiries, unless forced to do so; and there is an absence of accountability for students, which, to be fair, is first and foremost up to the parents to address - but that doesn't mean that ISS should continue to set expectations without consequences, as well.

My husband and I still believe the IB program has great potential and merit, but we do not feel that ISS (Degerloch or Sindelfingen) has done all that it can to effectively execute it.

name: Club Z! In-Home Tutoring - Northwestern Arkansas

review.author: Noah W.
review.description: The food is awful and the pool is closed to everyone except the swim team. The dorms are small and the place place is smelly and dirty.If I could give it less than even zero stars I would.

review.author: Mark D.
review.description:
Now my son went here and he said that the classes were fair if not too hard and that the campus was beautiful and spacious. I appreciated the head heart hand motto of the school because it taught him to love the lord and act on that love. 

He said the surrounding town is smaller than a button and sometimes the folks there give him a weird look because he has blue hair but in general he was treated well. 

The school was very accommodating and helped him go through the trauma of my wife's and my separation. He went through a rough patch and we are so blessed that he had his friends to guide him through this stressful time. They loved the lord and loved him so well and Steven was so good to him, helping him with his studies and just being a shoulder to cry on. 

I cannot stress enough that this school is well worth the money, will teach you to love the lord and your fellow man. In fact we even got to welcome Steven into our family and it was unfortunate that Steven only got to spend 2 years there because he and the staff decided that there was a better place elsewhere for him after the wedding. 

Best 168k we spent on our boys.

review.author: Daniel F.
review.description: This was an solid experience. We had great community during my time there (08-12), and still have some friends to this day from there even though it's 6 hours from my home town. The spiritual emphasis there is unparalleled, as I felt like I was on a spiritual high for much of my time there. Many of the people there love God deeply, and it rubs off. I also loved the area; if you're down for adventure and beautiful scenery and prime locations for finding more to do, NWA is the area to be . Loved it.

review.author: Mckenzie E.
review.description:
If you desire an education that puts Christ at the focal point, then this is the best university I know for you. John Brown chooses professors who desire to teach in a way that will prepare their students to use their gifts to glorify God. They've got the best art program I've ever experienced, and everyone on campus is aware of how important each major is to serve in Gods kingdom and better the world. 
However, if you are a person who wants to party in college, John Brown is not for you. John Brown only requires you to not participate in things like drinking, gambling, premarital sex, or anything that might lead you to participate in those things for the time that you are enrolled at John Brown. 
I've never seen a college like this. Everyone I've talked to who has experienced public colleges says that they are relieved and refreshed by the JBU environment. It's very hard to find a place like this in the US. I've had the best experience. 
If you have any questions message me!

review.author: Polly S.
review.description: Both of our daughters attended JBU and both have nothing negative to say. They thouroughly enjoyed their time there. So much so that when their dad decided to go back for an engineering degree at age 52, there was no other place he would rather be. Their engineering graduates have a 100% job placement rate. The financial aid is top notch. It is a Christian school without the guilt but they do hold the students to a high moral standard. The oldest dorms are under refurbishment right now. The others are standard, basic dorm rooms with everything you need but not fancy. There are some town houses and apartments on campus for upper classmen and many rent apartments off campus. Siloam Springs is a wonderful Christian community. Alcohol sales were just approved a few years ago. Low crime. Nice Hispanic community. Lots of jobs. Beautiful scenery.

review.author: James K.
review.description:
I'm sure that some of my friends would disagree with me, but JBU is a solid institution. Like Rebecca said, it's got it's faults, but it's got it's ups as well.

It's a Christian university, and that can be felt pretty much everywhere on the campus. They're starting to be more open to homosexuals attending the school, but still things like smoking cigarettes/drinking (even if you're of age) will get you into huge trouble. The thing is they have you sign a community covenant at the beginning of each school year, so you're agreeing to the rules. I've been told that if you don't want to abide by the rules, then you don't really need to be attending school here. Makes sense to me.

While it has it's downs the ups far outweigh it. I actually like that they don't allow drinking/parties in the dorms. Don't get me wrong, we still have plenty of laughs and good times, but we also get our work done. If there was alcohol flowing at all times I'm pretty sure there would be a lot less studying going on. 

Overall a great school, and I would recommend it if you're looking for a solid education and don't mind not having a party within spitting distance every night.

Message me if you want more info.

review.author: Nataliya L.
review.description: More downsides than up here, unfortunately. Not worth the price of tuition, especially considering the oppression you'll experience during your time there. Room and board is outrageous even though the dorms are old, less than accommodating, and shabby. A lot of favoritism, so if your parents don't have a building named after them don't get your hopes up on getting anything much out of schooling here. Message me for more information.

review.author: Rebecca G.
review.description: I attended 3 years of college here. It's got it's faults but overall I say my experience was solid. Message me for more detailed questions.

review.author: Kate A.
review.description:
My children have been so happy at St. Francis School. They have made great friends. When you are at the school you can see a level of kindness and respect amongst the students that is really refreshing to experience. 

Here's my best example of the amazing attitude of the kids at St. Francis: I booked my 3rd grade son's birthday party for the same day as the 2 nd grade First Communion. The 3rd grade boys including my son all agreed to "have the party fast", because they wanted to be able to support their 2nd grade prayer buddies at the First Communion. The boys came to this on their own without parents involvement!

The teachers have kept me informed about my children's progress over the years. They have been encouraging to the kids.  Early intervention in struggling areas has led to my son earning top scores in class work and test scores.

My husband and I have made lasting friendships. There are opportunities to be involved and I feel my opinion counts in the community.

review.author: Taylor C.
review.description: My daughter loves this place! It is the best in town and they treat everyone like family which makes it even better!

review.author: Chelsea G.
review.description: TLC is a wonderful daycare! My son has attended for 2 years and has thrived! It's a small cozy feel with dedicated and loving teachers that share Christian principles with the kids in a fun and nurturing way. My son runs in and is bummed everyday to leave his friends! I highly recommend it.

name: Kumon Math and Reading Center of Beaverton - South

review.author: Angel S.
review.description: Yes finally we got a Kumon @ Beaverton, kids will be much smarter, not that they arent already smart but more willing

review.author: Nancy S.
review.description: Kumon is a well tested learning system that works wonders. You may think that only overachieving moms have their kids do Kumon, and yes, perhaps many do, but so do the moms (like me) who want their children to be able to whiz through their school homework and feel confident about learning in general. The 20 minutes per day of math or reading exercises takes discipline and is a little bit of an investment, but it is a very worthwhile one if you want to set your child on a course of learning that isn't dependent on flashy digital images for short attention spans. My 6 year old son is the envy of his class as he often helps fellow classmates with their writing and math homework, and he's just a kindergartner! My 16 year old daughter has really benefitted from the Kumon Algebra work she did prior to taking on Algebra at high school, and now she is preparing for her future Calculus classes as a Junior.\nThis particular Kumon Center is outstanding (having attended others); they really invest in a well trained staff and so there is a very generous staff to student ration there at all times to assure your child that they will get the help they need. I'm also grateful that they are located at Progress Ridge so that I can shop nearby and don't have to struggle for parking.

review.author: Maria A.
review.description:
We joined Cadence early 2021. Our now 2 year old attended this daycare till our move out of state.
This is a very clean and well maintained facility. During COVID they followed all protocols and i felt that it was not just done to follow policies, but out of genuine care of staff and families.
Our son initially joined Ms Kashmala's class. We have been receiving Early Intervention services due to delayed speech and walking and were very open about our needs. While we couldnt visit daycare inside at that time during COVID, Ms Kashmala set up a call with us to discuss how she can support our son's development. She asked a lot of questions and it just made me feel at ease. It is clear that she really cares about kids in her class. Thank you!
Our son later transitioned to Ms Michelle's class and ~around the same time parents were able to visit the daycare inside. Ms Michelle is just an amazing teacher and so very caring. Always positive, upbeat and absolutely fantastic with kids. I appreciate how caring and attentive she is.
All other teachers that are employed there are amazing. We had so many other teachers helping out occasionally or primarily in the afternoons and we were very pleased with them.
When it comes to the director and assistant director - they are rock stars. They had to manage through COVID, changes in state's response to it, weather and they handled it so well. We appreciate everything you do.
I highly recommend Cadence to any parent that is looking for a center for their kids.

review.author: Charmaine R.
review.description: I cannot recommend Cadence Academy in Sherwood enough! My son is in the pre-K program and absolutely loves it. This is saying alot since he cried almost every day last year going to a difference preschool. Now he often says he wants to go to Cadence on the weekend because he likes it so much! We could not be happier. Everyone from the Director to the teachers are so welcoming and responsive to any and all needs. The education in my opinion is great! He is learning upper and lower case letters, numbers including addition and counting by 2s, 5s and 10s and he can write his name and knows the days of the week and months of the year. He is well prepared for Kindergarten next year because of Cadence.

review.author: Whitney J.
review.description: My pre-schooler joined Cadence just a few weeks ago and we are so appreciative of all the wonderful teachers there and (from day one) have been so welcoming and so wonderful! My preschooler came from another daycare that just wasn't the right fit for him anymore and so I was a little nervous about his transition. But, the staff at Cadence has made it nothing but like home for him. He actually looks forward to school each day and they are getting him back on track for Kindergarten (as he was falling behind at his previous daycare). \nThey also have amazing communication and are always looking for fun things to do at their center so the kiddo's can look forward to activities/dress up days/parties -etc. \nI am so happy we made this transition and just want to thank the Cadence staff for being so awesome!!

review.author: Jessica P.
review.description: Our daughter has been going to Cadence since she was 6 months old (she is now 3 1/2). There had been some turnover which was my only concern (this would be with any daycare) but they have a solid director now and I have been happy with the majority of the teacher's. The infant teacher, Linda, is the best there is out there. In my daughter's current class, they are learning letters, how to count, colors and other learning activities. There are no tv's just time to play and learn with other children which is awesome. I have been very happy with them and I really love that the daycare is a preschool as well.

review.author: Diana P.
review.description:
We've been part of the Phoenix Children's Academy family for the last 6 years. Both of my children started when they were 11 weeks old. We've been thru all the classrooms from infant to school-age and have had the opportunity to meet so many wonderful teachers. The teachers truly care about the kids. My children absolutely adore the staff and often times visit with and give hugs to their former teachers.  

The curriculum at Phoenix Children's Academy is top-notch! They really do a fantastic job of preparing the kids for grade school.  In Pre-K they learn how to write their names, write and recognize upper/lower case letters, letter phonics, and number recognition, among other things. In the latter half of Pre-K they start something called "Kindergarten Club" to help with the transition. 

I could go on and on about how much I appreciate everything this school has done for our kids. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out!

review.author: Ali T.
review.description: This is not based on the teachers just the management. The school let their NAEYC accreditation lapse right after we started(Oct 2018). We specifically picked them for this since it was a requirement for the military subsidy I was eligible for. They did not inform any parents that it lapsed and kept the NAEYC accredit on their website until we discovered it several months later(Feb 2019). We had to jump through hoops to get them approved since they had lost their accreditation. We finally did and received back pay for the 6 months we had paid in full. Unfortunately before we could use up all the back pay we had to move again to a different state. There was a balance of $527 left in my account. The school has refused to pay me the money left in my account. Their services have been paid in full 100%. We left in June and have been trying to get our money back since then. It is now October and they will not even answer my calls or emails. If you need to count on the management for anything don't hold your breath.\n\nUpdate: They did eventually refund my money in Nov (5 months later) after I continued to call/email and leave messages. Thankfully the local director cared enough to resolve this for me.

review.author: Luke R.
review.description: We recently started taking our daughters to Phoenix academy after trying 3 others in the area. We could not be happier with how well they take care of kids. Our 4 year old is actually learning something! The infant room is great also, I don't feel like 1 year old is going to get sick Everytime she goes to school. I highly recommend this school. The staff is great and they have a new director who really seems to be making a big difference

review.author: Deborah F.
review.description: We have been very happy with Cadence in Sherwood.  Our daughter loves her teachers and is usually excited for school!  It puts our mind at ease knowing she is with caring and loving teachers and staff.

review.author: Brenda S.
review.description: My youngest finished pre-k this week and that means our 6 years at Phoenix is coming to at end. It's like saying goodbye to family after watching both of my kids make their way from the toddler classrooms up through pre-k. We were so fortunate to have kind, dedicated, nurturing teachers every step of the way. Both of my kids loved going to Phoenix and I was always happy with the high quality care and learning opportunities they were provided. Thank you PCA!

review.author: Chelsea G.
review.description: My son has attended for 3 years. The staff and facility could not be better! I recommend it to everyone. He will be completely prepared for elementary school and I can go to work knowing he is well cared for!

review.author: Hilda W.
review.description: I couldn't imagine our son anywhere else. He is truly getting a quality education at 4 yrs! The teachers care for his well being and see him as an individual. Food is provided...the menu looks amazing. Having had him I another local pre school that was more of a daycare setting, I can say I'd recommend PCA to any parent of any aged child.

review.author: Laura D.
review.description: Great and friendly service! My hair looks great. Extremely affordable. I'll come here again and I've recommended it to family and friends.

review.author: Rae D.
review.description:
I have gotten color, highlights mostly, every three months for about a year and a half now. 

A few things I feel they do well include COVID response, professionalism, explaining the process (or what they are doing), and pricing 

Students are great, making sure to check in with their instructors prior to beginning any treatment and during when they have questions. Nancy (instructor) is wonderful and seems to really enjoy her job, which seems to be great for the students. Makes for a comfortable environment. 

Things I think they could improve upon include... honestly, nothing. They are students so the techniques,  cuts, or color isn't always exactly what I want, but I'm not picky and I love the prices (extremely affordable) plus I highly value education of all kinds... so getting my hair done here really makes sense for me and my family. 

We have gotten hair color (many techniques), hair cuts, eyebrow waxing, and we send my mom (in her 60s) for a wash and dry once in a while as a treat, she loves it.  

If you are picky, or have high expectations perhaps this isn't the place for you. BUT If you are flexible and tolerant of a possible mistake made by a student, then  I highly recommend making an appointment here!

 They even do waxing, nails, and facials!

review.author: Anjelica S.
review.description: I will like to start this off with say that I've been coming here for six years. And I've never had such a horrible experience. The girl that I had doing my hair it was very sweet and wonderful. And I don't blame her for anything that happened because she was new to the floor And I know their students and they make mistakes. However Nancy should have been watching her and what she was doing. I'm going back to what I said I've been going there for years. And I have never not seen an instructor check up on the student. In the past I have always scheduled with very experienced students and the instructor has always checked on them once or twice throughout the process even with them being experienced students. And in my last visit not once did they come up and check on what she was doing to my hair. They decided that they were going to just chitchat the whole entire time and not check up on her while she fried my hair. I had shown them a picture of highlights and the coloring I wanted  and I currently had highlights in my hair when I showed up to the appointment. I told her when I was getting my highlights done that I wanted them closer to the scalp. She said that she could do that and I had spoken to Nancy When the student got the OK to proceed with my appointment. I am so beyond mad that it took me three months to write this review. The pictures I posted a before and after photo

review.author: Noelle C.
review.description:
I wasn't going to write this review on this platform but the salon academy has taken their reviews down off their Facebook page because of so many negative reviews coming in, but I feel obligated to share my experience with everyone so no one else has to experience this school as a client or student. I started going to the Salon Academy back in June 2020, the reason why is because one of my close friends was a student there and I was helping her get her services. Everything started out okay, until the director of the school Nancy Ferguson decided she had a problem with the student I was seeing. From this point forward everything became a horrible experience, not only for me as the client but also for this student as well. Here are some prime examples, in beauty school you have to provide models to test out on modules that you learn in school. I was going to be a make up model, for the student I arrived on time for my appointment and was the first one there out of the models, I proceeded to wait 20 minutes for the school to be ready to perform the test out on this module, this is when the instructor decided that there was no longer enough room for her whole class to test out and that she was going to exclude this student and me from this experience. I was then asked to leave in front of a whole waiting room and several students With no explanation as of to why or an apology for wasting my time. My friend messaged me letting know how distressed the situation made her and that she was coming home, before realizing Nancy took her purse and personal possessions, locked them in her office, then forced the distressed student to participate, starting 15 plus minutes late working on a random student, and then the instructor was irritated towards her the whole time. Definitely not a safe learning environment. 

The next situation that baffled me, was when I was in the MIDDLE of receiving a facial when Nancy walks in again and instructed the student to walk out into the hall with her?? They then came back she informed me my service was over because the student needed to take a lunch.. I still paid for this service. I also later learned that the light therapy service I was paying extra for was not being counted for this student because Nancy had decided they had not yet properly taught the students how to be using this device.. (the student normally receives an extra point for this service as it is an add on.) So even though I was charged for this service, the student was not to receive any credit. This seems very unprofessional and questionable to me as a client. 

Lastly, the receptionist Amelia Michaelson was SO unprofessional talking with clients and students about how unorganized she thought Nancy was and much more about how she couldn't stand working for her, etc. She also would talk about very inappropriate things such as paraphernalia with students and so on.. 

I could share much more on this situation but I will leave it at this. This school does NOT host a positive or supportive environment for their students or clients, and I would never and never will be going back to support this school as long as Nancy Ferguson is apart of this business. 

Sincerely, 

A concerned Wilsonville community member.

review.author: Lexi S.
review.description: HORRIBLE PLACE! She got so many bad reviews on Facebook that it was at a NEGATIVE 5 stars. Then she proceeded to block comments and disable reviews. Clearly she is in the wrong...embarrassing!!!! Do not send your child here

review.author: Hunter Y.
review.description: I wish I could give this place 0 stars! The director is horrible to her students with bullying! They will hold students back for no reason at all. As a client the atmosphere is not good all the students are constantly on there toes almost as if there scared. All in all I will never step foot in this salon.

review.author: Carly R.
review.description:
Marley Martinez did a wonderful job on my hair and she was so great to work with. After such a good experience with her I decided to get a manicure there since it is right next to my office. 

First experience: I don't remember the gals name but she was very quiet -I was happy with the outcome of my nails. I did however notice that the salon was almost out of all nail color selections and top coats, I figured since it was the end of the month they may just be running out of inventory. 

Second Experience: I came back, worked with a different gal- once again very quiet and didn't say more than two sentences to me. Once again, they were out of almost all nail color selections and the technician had to use the barrel of the bottom to even finish my nails. Afterwards, the  lady working at the front of the salon (colored hair, taller) asked me how my experience was and I replied "It was okay, I did notice that your technicians are lacking a lot of supplies though." Her response was "That is unfortunate."

Some basis observations after my few times here: 
- Management rarely checks on the nail technician's work during or after to critique 
- Management is not very professional or friendly at the front of the salon and does not seem to care much for customer's satisfaction of service. 
- Management does not conduct proper inventory audits to ensure students have the required materials to perform their job correctly 
- Did I already mention management is very unprofessional? 
- Management or front desk help running the show here lack professional and appropriate communication skills to ensure clients are satisfied - even if it is a beauty school! Also, do they even teach the students how to interact with clients? This is a great opportunity for them to network and earn lifelong clientele! 

If you're looking for a cheap manicure, by all means try it out. Be prepared to have a three option color selection and be on your own if your nail technician messes up. If you're looking for a great hair stylist, ask for Marley Martinez - she is amazing.

review.author: Robin B.
review.description: I love this program! It provides affordable care for the community and a place for people to learn how to be the professionals of tomorrow. I highly recommend The Salon Academy! It's good all the way around.

review.author: Josue G.
review.description: I tried calling for an appointment over and over again and they never answered the phone I called about 4 times In different times and never answered me. The students are nice tho the teachers or whatever are not the best I was getting my nails done and the teacher approached the student doing my nails and told her some mistakes she did somewhere like kinda unprofessional and awkward I only go because Cynthia is nice and I like when she does my nails

review.author: Nhi L.
review.description: I can not say enough good things about this place. I absolutely love it, and as I'm watching my fianc get his hair cut, it seems as though he loves it too. These people are so sweet and amazing at what they do. They really care that you are happy with your service and that you want to keep coming back for more. It is a very open area with a lot of natural lighting tucked behind shops. Very modern looking and has a very bright and happy atmosphere. I will always keep coming back for more!

review.author: Dina H.
review.description: I first went to The Salon Professional Academy a few months ago, and was excited that Wilsonville now has a school.  The first time I went was great, and while it took a long time for a haircut (I was there 2 hours), I'm in my seventies and had the time.  I was very pleased with the service and went back 2 or 3 times!  Then, I was leaving on a trip and went back for a haircut a couple of days before I left.  Terrible haircut, but went back the next day for a mani-pedi. I should've known better!  I always tell manicurists that I'm diabetic.  I was there from 12:00 until 4:00 PM!  First, a manicure which was unlike anything I've ever had! I went on to the pedicure (done by the same student).  Unlike any pedicure I've ever experienced.  The instructor came over and gave her instructions periodically, then disappeared and she proceeded to completely disregard what she had been told.  I ended up with four coats of polish on my toenails (none of them dry before the next was applied, and it kept bleeding into the cuticles.  I finally had her remove all of it and I left.  By this time I was shaking.  Four hours, and I had missed lunch.  I was not offered so much as a drink of water!  When I got to the front, I was told that I owed for a basic mani-pedi, instead of the "deluxe".  I told them to look my feet, and asked if that looked like a pedicure!  The response was "I'm sorry you weren't satisfied with the service"!  I paid them (which I shouldn't have done), left and will never go back.  I don't blame the student.  The instructors and administration did her as much a disservice as they did to me!  They should be "teaching" their students who have paid for the school!  They also should be taught how to treat their clients, as well as techniques and skills.  I don't usually do things like this review; but I really feel that I need to in this instance.  Hopefully someone at the Academy will read this, and pay attention.

review.author: Nanci C.
review.description: Had roots touched up and was very impressed with professionalism, customer service, thoroughness.  Very well run operation.  Will be going back soon!!

name: Center for Research in Environmental Sciences & Tech

review.author: Jen K.
review.description:
Kids - 33.  Mom - 5.

One of the nasty little surprises for parents of school aged children are these pesky little things called holidays and school closure days. The count above reflects the number of days during the school year that the primary schools in my district are closed vs. the number of days my company recognizes as holidays. Notice a little discrepancy?

Well, mother's little helper isn't a glass of chardonnay. For some of those days, it is CREST to the rescue.

A public school education in West Linn - Wilsonville is quite good. But, even in the best of times, exposing your kids to new concepts with a focus on nature, science, inquiry and exploration is never a bad thing. And guess what? These full day programs are scheduled to coincide with days the public schools are closed. 

CREST works in conjunction with the WLWV school district and they operate a research facility and farm in Wilsonville. CREST isn't open on a daily basis to the public, but you can call them to schedule a tour. They also have an open house every fall [1] and special events throughout the year. They've even partnered with Audubon in the past for wildlife releases.

My children have benefited from CREST programs for years. A few of their 'Learning on the Go' programs take place at the CREST facility, but more often than not, they are field trips. Amazing trips to parks, wetlands, creeks and farms. The programs are grade level specific, so on the same day they may offer two programs. One for grades 1 - 3 and another for grades 2 - 5. This isn't a cheap option ($35 - 40/day), but I consider it money well spent.

The highlight for my oldest son last year was their week long spring break trip to the Oregon Coast. My son had an absolute blast and they perfectly balanced education and fun. 

Another reason why this is the best of the best in my area is that the district created a Farm-to-School program, managed by CREST, so they have a 10-acre plot to raise fresh produce for our district's food program. 

I can't say enough good things about the staff. Both on the administrative and the educational side. A public school education can be a mixed bag, but CREST earns full marks. They are totally on the honor roll.

[1] Open House is September 18, 2010 from 10am - 2 pm

review.author: Dave O.
review.description: We have been sending our daughter to Mathnasium since they reopened after COVID-19 hit. They are super professional, they make the sessions fun and our daughter is gaining confidence in her math skills. They have very high safety precautions around the Covid virus, masks, sneeze guards, consistent washing of hands, and hand sanitizing station. I would definitely recommend Mathnasium.

review.author: Nancy J.
review.description: Awesome experience! Literally changed my sons math in three months. My A plus daughter did summer session and has sky rocketed this year also. Great approach by filling in the holes in math to sling shot forward. If there are no holes these guys will challenge you and show you math in totally different areas.

review.author: Kevin H.
review.description:
I hope that this review helps to ease the stress of your child learning to drive safely.
Our son has Autism and needless to say was a bit late to the driving game (23 yoa)  While we did not care if he EVER drove, we knew that it was inevitably a necessity.
We researched for weeks and finally decided to enroll him in the Driving MBA program.
It was the best decision we could have ever made.  Everyone there is very patient and accommodating.  The program is INTENSE to say the least.  It is focused on safety and a very rigorous program that even included us as parents committing to doing the "homework" after each session.
Homework was in the form of driving.  They ask for 100 hours outside of the program.  The DMV requires only 30 total!
It took us over a year, but last week our son passed his driver's license test administered by Driving MBA.  It was almost 2 hours!  
Again...DMV driving tests are 30 minutes at best.
While it will still be a while before he is ready to hit the road alone, we know that he has received the best training we could ask for.
His instructors, Navar and Dawn were amazing and the owner Maria really takes pride and is involved to ensure that only the strictest guidelines are followed.
Yes...It is a bit expensive and very involved, but the cost of knowing that we have prepared him as best as we can for this experience is nothing in comparison to receiving a random phone call from a police officer or even worse hospital with not so great news
We are happy and blessed to have found Driving MBA.  You will be too.

review.author: Jennifer B.
review.description: -------------------------\nI feel very confident that my son is prepared to drive safely on our busy roads after completing the DrivingMBA program. I'm very pleased with the overall program and instructors.

review.author: Allison G.
review.description: Driving mba has an amazing exceptional learners program! They are extremely knowledgeable, thorough, and caring. They would not put my stepson on the road until he was ready! They truly care about the safety of their students. I would highly recommend this program for anyone who has a child with special needs! Kathleen Ryan is outstanding in every way!

review.author: Rachel B.
review.description: So let me start by saying my husband, Justin, wrote a review tonight. I am writing a review to provide more perspective to Maria, who apparently needs a healthy dose of it. \nMaria-this is aimed specifically to you. There is not a business in America that doesn't pay for their employees time when cancellations occur. Not. A. One. The fact that you think you are somehow unique in this regard is mind boggling to me. Where do I start? Doctor? Dentist? Chiropractor? Physical therapy? Staff for all these? And I read the other poor reviews. I love how you've tried to mitigate these cancellations with doctors notes but it was too much to handle. Really? You have a staffing problem over there? You couldn't be further outside the bounds of reasonable. Like on another planet. What  you really want is for ALL your sick customers to show up-infection be damned. Covid has made EVERY BUSINESS make allowances. It is different-this isn't strept throat. I would STRONGLY ADVISE you to make sure you VERBALLY tell everyone that signs up the covid rule. I assure you that you will get push back -or just have folks show up sick-and that my dear, is on you. For not being reasonable DURING A PANDEMIC. Honestly, you should be ashamed of yourself.

review.author: Jennifer C.
review.description: Very professionally run, felt like my daughter had an excellent basis for her driving. Such a relief to have help with this important learning skill.

review.author: Mr. Patrick B. H.
review.description: I like these people. They are funny (have a sense of humor), and as best I can tell they make a good faith endeavor to follow through on all commitments as stated. In communicating with them about the possibility of training I felt that they wished to help me optimize my skills in a healthy and nurturant manner while maintaining professional protocol. As far as I'm concerned that's how business should be done. Current life challenges may not allow me to take up training in the immediate future, and I will also keep this organization in mind for the future.

review.author: Susie R.
review.description: Thank you so much Driving MBA.  Two of my kids graduated from your program, and I am very happy with the results.  I have 2 very safe drivers.  I appreciate how well your program is run and all the excellent information you provide to both students and parents.  Thank you for everything you do.

review.author: Mike K.
review.description: Great driving school that I would highly recommend.  My daughter really learned a lot of great information and skills that will help to keep her safe on the road.  The instructors were excellent and my daughter enjoyed all her driving lessons.  She completed the hours we signed up for with the school and also practiced a lot with my wife and myself and then passed the driving test administered by the school feeling very confident.  I am very happy we had my daughter attend Driving MBA.

review.author: Justin B.
review.description:
Totally insensitive!  I am respectful and mindful of cancellation fees although I cannot digest this one.  I called Driving MBA this PM as my son was in contact with a friend whose dad was diagnosed with C-19 today.  
I called Driving MBA out of an abundance of caution, and respect.  To be clear, my son was not in direct contact with the individual whom was diagnosed with C-19, but was in contact with his friend whom has not been diagnosed with C-19.  My son feels fine and will only be tested for Covid in the event that his health circumstances change; OR, if his friend was to have a change of circumstances.
Regardless, per Driving MBA policy, my son now cannot come in for his appt. tonight per their policy and Driving MBA are going to charge me an additional $50 (above and beyond the ~$1,350 that I have already invested) for the inconvenience, I.e. a cancellation fee.  Further, they offered to sell me some cancellation insurance.  Are you kidding me!
